Unknown Time 
 
ipam

Teen outer space love story…



I am seventeen years old Starra Starbelt, a former crop farmer who used to live and work on Planet Earth.

Back on Planet Earth, a team of smart scientists have discovered that our home world Earth will implode within five calendar years or maybe less.

The worried set of United Earth government officials has sent out a team of outer space astronauts, who possess a set of special powers like a witch, but not really.

The government has sent out a team of Tele people, who possess telepathy or mind reading and telekinesis or object floating, into a new galaxy that includes me.

So, I take off to fly the first ever freaking earthling intergalactic outer space journey coming off trashy Planet Earth, sailing to the beautiful Milky Way Galaxy, and then going through a stupid red and blue pretty wormhole.

Now, I exhale with a puff of frustration and cross my arms over a dirty tee jumpsuit, shaking my bangs in my eyelashes and stomp a fashion boot, looking up to see a pale blue sky with white colored clouds, and a bright yellow sun.

I am impressed with the new planet, but I wanna go back home to Earth like right now, ya’ll.


Citizens of the unknown universe:

Ann, Lady of Bonita
Bartholomew, Baron of Agri
Bea, Countess of Ice
Dee, Marquise of Resort
Dirk, Lord of Bonita
Dov, Count of Ice
Ivan, General of Militia
Ito, Priest of Bio
Ivy, Baronetess of Agri
Jo, Governess of Uni
Jon, Governor of Uni
Kona, Major of Militia
Lad, Viscount of Tech
Las, Priestess of Bio
Mar, Generalette of Militia
Rann, Prince of Sahara
Rex, King of Commerce
Rita, Queen of Commerce
Rosa, Lady of Bonita
Roy, Marquis of Resort
Tok, Marquis of Resort
Ty, Administrator of Sahara
Viv, Princess of Sahara
Zak, Baronet of Agri


Planets of the unknown universe:

Agri, planet of food and livestock or Food World
Bio, planet of medical facilities
Bonita, planet of land
Commerce, planet of Royal family and the Game
Ice, planet of snow and ice
Militia, space station of honor guards, pilots, police
Resort, planet of casinos and entertainment center
Sahara, planet of prisoners or Prison Planet
Tech, planet of technology or Tech World
Uni, planet of school
Wall, divider between the two solar suns


Bots of the unknown universe:


Abot, agricultural robot
Bbot, biological robot
Cbot, conqueror robot
Dbot, door robot
Ebot, evacuation robot
Fbot, football robot
Gbot, guard robot
Hbot, housekeeping robot
Ibot, inn robot
Jbot, jury robot
Kbot, kitchen robot
Lbot, lady robot
Mbot, messenger robot
Nbot, news robot
Obot, orchestra robot
Pbot, pilot robot
Qbot, etiquette robot
Rbot, repair robot
Sbot, service robot
Tbot, testing robot
Ubot, “U better not run” robot
Vbot, love robot
Xbot, excavation robot
Ybot, yard robot
Zbot, zipper robot

Present alien day and place and time and space continues…


Alien Day 97


Planet Resort location
10th hour (late morning)

Destroyed tall structure setting
Dark brown sky of pollution without clouds and sunlight at 57ºF


Within the square-shaped interior walls of a silver-tinted carrier ship, which was piloted by a silent, matching Pbot inside an enclosed cockpit making weird sounds and slapping console instruments, the main chamber was an open space of lined benches in peach-tinted fabric that ran around a row of glass windows.
I quietly sat on the edge of bench and looked out the glass window and away from Dirk. He relaxed on the opposite side and stared at the opposite glass window, without offering a light chit-chat with social conversation, a game strategy with the pirates or an exchange of vocabulary nasty words, like usual, between our strong Tele personalities. I sighed with nervousness. 
I closed my gray tinted eyelashes at the glass. Breathe in. Breathe out. Relax. Calm. Concentrate. Focus.
The space flight was very quiet and very quick exhibiting an array of speeding colors in hues of blue, yellow, and red starburst patterns inside the glass windows. Asteroid Resort looked both nasty and unpleasant in icky light, medium, and dark brown tones from massive destruction within the Galactic Civil War last alien timeline.
I was discovering too late. Once a planet or a person was damaged or dead, that object was dead or damaged within the new alien timeline.

Geez! I need to fix all this mess faster than a zipper’s flight.

As the ship sailed from outer space and glided low over the ground soil, each building structure was completed destroyed and appeared as a high pile of red tinted rubble, brown colored stones, yellow tinted rocks, and white colored concrete blocks of crumbled worthless matter underneath a layer of brown dirty air that consumed the yellow sun beams and created a new atmosphere of darkness and dampness.


I mentally flashed backwards, within the first alien timeline, Planet Resort was nicknamed, the Party Planet.

The planet held numerous tall, shiny casinos and visitor hotels, sailing boats for water skiing and deep-sea fishing, an array of colorful amusement parks with fun rides, people parades with colorful balloons in the air waves, and other sky, land, and sea activities for each citizen or family clan within the unknown universe.


Then, I mentally flashed present, I honestly didn’t understand how a group of citizens survived down there, but I was going to find out, soonest.

Yeah, I hate that word, soonest.

“Land here, Pbot!” Dirk reached over and pressed the button, speaking a string of words, instead of using his Tele power of telepathy on the dumb metal machine.
Like him, I found an object, without flesh and thought, hard to manipulate with my Tele talent other than flying around with a dead piece of machine.
The carrier slowed the pace and then halted in the air waves with a smooth machine hand, slowly descending on top of the brown soil. In the close distance, there was a single crumbled building in red rubble and yellow stones, where no one should be living. The carrier landed with a slight thud.
My T-senses pinged. Everything ain’t fine.
I wiggled side to side on top of the bench seat and continued to stare through the side window at the crumbled building without using a Tele probe.
Dirk was a strong Tele master as he would feel my extended Tele probe from my open mind. Then he would learn about one of her many Tele talents which Starra had kept hidden from him and all the other natives for obvious reasons. He swiftly stood with a soft chuckle and moved ahead toward the sliding door which had been activated by Pbot. He exited the ship and moved outside into the humid air and bright sunlight without a word, only a smile.
Inside the main chamber, I continued to sit and produced a face of wet sweat balls, slowly standing upright from the bench, wringing my hands without a weapon again. This was a diplomatic mission from Rann, without a deadly weapon or a fist fight with Dirk. I swiftly moved ahead and hauled my body out into the dull sunrays.
Dirk rushed ahead with purpose from the grounded ship and an annoying Starra as he could pose as the pretend polished diplomatic.
I didn’t care here. As long as the gang of pirates was happy, and then the universe was safe again.
I slowly spun around and continued to move ahead checking my front and my back for a quick or quiet foul play coming from my number one enemy Dirk, viewing the burnt and damaged landscape plus tons of man-made broken buildings under a dark blanket of depression. Then I tripped over a perturbing piece of indigo colored concrete and performed a T-hold catching my folded in the air waves. I exhaled with relief and nervousness, slowing standing upright in the air with my telekinesis, staring ahead at the back spine on Dirk. He stopped, then climbed up a sturdy, tall, light-colored wooden ladder that led into an opening on a taller destroyed building as his mint green body cape flew through the wind.
I gasped in alarm without dropping down over the jagged landscape, flying through the wind, heading towards the same something and softly sneered at his disappearance. “Dirk, what have you done here?”
My Tele senses pinged. Everything ain’t fine.
“I know! I know that! Stop annoying me!” I continued to sneer and rushed into danger, like always. I glided through the air and slammed into the open archway of jagged stone chips, cutting both of my open palms. “Stang! That hurt, Dirk!” Even though, Dirk was not at fault. Now, I was mad and annoyed without meeting the first pirate person for this royal mission thing.
Inside the dark opening, down a long darker tunnel, which used to be a hallway of numerous bedroom suites for vacationers, I spotted the back spine on Dirk. He slowly strolled ahead like he was walking on a Sunday afternoon through a grassy park of barking dogs and planted peonies.
I carefully struggled through the damaged opening and performed a T-glide down towards an uneven floor of stone, broken wooden planks, and smelly old carpet in indigo colors, standing upright with a huff of frustration. I waved both of my hands for drama and slowly lifted a few inches from the floor, performing a T-fly in the air, following Dirk with worry.
In the middle of the long, dark hallway, Dirk stopped with a smirk and turned into a new opening, disappearing out of sight again.
My vivid memory recalled during one of the other noble meetings that General Ivan had tattled that some of the pirates had been escaped criminal convicts from Planet Sahara, where Dirk had been the noble in charge, by chance or luck or purpose. I sighed with worry.
“Stang!” I pulled my Tele flight faster down the hallway and then halted beside a small opening that only a small child could crawl through, carefully landing down on the uneven floor. 
Planet Resort had taken some major bumps and bruises from the Galactic Civil War which had been caused by the royal pair of Dirk and Rita, within the last two alien timelines. I clearly had recalled the two separate events within my mind and remembered the destroyed structures too.
Now, I posed inside one of the tallest damaged building with my number one enemy Dirk. The hallway appeared both dark and dead with lots of rusty equipment, broken walls, busted furniture, and smashed out wooden doors and glass windows. I sighed with creeped out.
I continued to stand and exhaled with worry, dropping my folded body down on top of the uneven floor, carefully crawling through a medium-sized opening, slowly standing upright inside a semi-dark room. The room appeared very long and wide which had been used to be an auditorium. An ancient tan colored rock avalanche had re-designed two walls and most of the floor, where ancient citizens had danced and cheered, now their ghosts did. I sighed with prayer.
Inside the semi-dark room, that had been illuminated by streaks of natural sunlight beams from the broken side wall, Dirk slowly moved upright against the rough wall, stopped, then knelt in the yellow dust of hard rock.
I sneezed out loud and wiped my running nostrils on the long sleeve on my new gray colored tee shirt, moving sideways from a rolling cloud of dust coming from the middle of the room with a chair or a table or a pirate.
Dirk was the dopy diplomatic here, wanting thee new job title. I sighed with laziness.
I continued to stand and scanned the entire theatre. No person or movement or motion or sound was located here. I could Tele-hear a series of constant faint buzzing sounds coming from all the insect chatter within my metaphysical world, feeling their presence, not their tiny insect bodies. I sighed with caution.
Within the semi-darkness between numerous streaks of dull sunlight coming down from the broken side wall, my eyeballs finally viewed a row of pirates, who stood on top of the highest man-made peak of yellow colored rocks that surrounded each the indigo concrete wall. I performed a Tele sight and viewed a missing body limb on each standing figure, such like, an arm or a leg or one hand or one foot or one ear or one eye or other body parts. Each pirate appeared as a grotesquely deformed humanoid, sorta, being thing. I sighed with concern.
On the intact and solid entrance wall of indigo hue, Dirk continued to stand with a smile and dusted off his pair of dirty hands, slowly scooting sideways, stopping beside Starra. He lifted and waved both of his arms in the air with a smile, shouting out loud to the line of pirates. “Come out! I am here. Do not be afraid!” He reached over and slammed his palm down on top of her hair roots, laughing out loud. “I have brought you a gift. Come on out and come and see!” He carried no physical gift, only his mint green tinted clothes, talking nonsense to the line of pirates.
In the far distance, one of the pirates slowly moved ahead and stopped, standing in the dull sunlight beams, forming a line with numerous deformed children first on the edge of the rock platform. I sighed with curiosity.
Some of the pirates had escaped from Rann’s old prison as told by General Ivan. However, the old prison building and the former boss Rann did not abuse one single prisoner with their crime or house a single child for any crime. I sighed with knowledge.
On top of the even floor, I stomped my foot and shook my curls with the real conclusion. Dirk had run and ruined and robbed from the Prison Planet. I turned and growled at the nose profile on Dirk.
Dirk continued to stand in place and lifted his hand in the air equal with the other one, slowly turning with an evil grin, viewing Starra in silence.
I executed a T-probe with my telepathy on his open mind collecting information. Dirk was the leader that had ordered all the freed pirates to attack and then blow up each ram ship. I sighed with deceit.
Dirk jabbed a finger at her and returned shouting out loud to the growing line of pirates on top of the rock ledge. “She is the gift. She has attacked your ships and killed your shipmates. She has destroyed the ram ship with your supplies and citizens. She has followed your citizens to your planet and killed them in cold blood with her secret powers.”
Each pirate continued to stand and waved one limb in the air, yeah, only one limb. Each one grunted out loud with a string of incoherent words to each other while nodding a deformed bone skull from Dirk’s acidic words at Starra.
I could hear a string of soft grunts throughout the air waves and then returned with a stern face viewing a growing line of pirates, saying out loud with puzzlement. “They have developed their own language that goes on between them.”
He continued to jab his finger at Starra, like an outer space advertisement, and yelled out loud at the row of pirates, “She is here. She is the cause of your concerns.”
I was not the cause of everything. I greatly desired to end the heated debate and then hang Dirk’s bone skull sideways dangling down from a set of damaged roof tiles, receiving a slow death by my hand. And I had figured all of that out, too late, as usual. I sighed with doom.
Dirk understood Starra. Within every alien timeline, she entered with her Free Will or Tele talents or pure alien magic. Then he attacked her, without cause, trying to kill her innocent teenager life form.
However, within the third alien timeline, Dirk had not attacked Starra. As a matter of interest, he had been very cordial and gentlemanly to her from the beginning of the new timeline.
I sensed a true snake hiding in the tall weeds ready to strike at my boot heels. I had demonstrated my range of secretive T-powers inside an array of open spaces too many times for a pair of spying eyeballs and a set of curious brain cells.
One, I had fought with a bigger Tok inside the Bar on Planet Commerce.
Second, I had fought with the three bigger Militia officers on Planet Sahara along with my fancy flying skills inside a zipper ship. 
Three, I had displayed my spectacular body fall from the open tower window on Planet Commerce while saving my love Rann.
Fourth, I had found the pirates and their secret base, where I would fight and kill of them in an upcoming tiny battle. I sighed with showmanship.
I linked, connected, and Tele talked to Dirk: I win.
Really! He linked, connected, and Tele talked back to Starra.
Really!
I really want to see that happen, Starra.
Well, it really will happen. So, sit down and watch and learn, Dirk, the lord of the lawless and losers.


I mentally flashed back past, within the second alien timeline, when I had performed a Tele kick on the Talisman from the open palm on an unconscious Dirk and lifted it into the hot winds on Planet Sahara.

The golden tined Talisman had landed somewhere near a fresh water lake within the orange colored heated desert sand.

Dirk had tried unsuccessfully to drain the Tele powers from Prince Rann during the First Galactic Civil War.


Then I flashed back into the present third alien timeline, Dirk had found the Talisman somewhere within the desert sands. A Tele can detect an animate object using their telepathy. However, royal noble Dirk used his own twisted Tele mind to control each mind on every pirate with that golden Talisman, someway, somehow, and somewhere. I sighed with mystery.
I could hear their mental mind clicks and soft throat grunts within my Tele mind, talking to each other, giving me a headache of confusion and worry.
I cut off my Tele link with Dirk, and returned, viewing the line of pirates.
I linked, connected, and Tele talked into each pirate’s mind: I am not going to hurt you.
Will she now? Dirk linked, connected, and Tele talked back each pirate also.
I turned and growled at the nose profile on Dirk.
No! I am here as a nice friend. I wanna talk, not fight. I linked, connected, and Tele talked to each pirate.
None of the pirates on top of the rock base bothered to link back and Tele talk within my mind as each one continued to listen to Dirk.
But I wanna fight and kill you, Dirk! I linked back, connected and Tele talked to him.
Really!
Really!
I wanna see that happen, also, Starra!”
I cut off the Tele link from Dirk with a soft growl and performed a T-jump from the stone floor and then held a T-hold in the air, slowly lifting both of my arms over my silver tinted sweaty hair roots for the ultimate death fight with my number one enemy.
Dirk continued to stand in place and wore a silly smirk, staring up at his number one enemy Starra in silence.
A medium-sized piece of indigo colored rock chunk sailed through the air waves with a loud whistle warning and then landed down in-between the air space of an air-borne Starra and a stationary Dirk.
I swiftly performed a T-back paddle with a set of wiggling arms and legs away from the very large and heavy flying object and then executed a T-halt in the air, staring with a gasp down at the broken indigo colored rock fragments that cracked a new opening on top of the stone floor with a sneer. I performed a T-spin and stared with a gasp at the rows of short and tall pirates that formed a type of new army. Now I was on the defense team against both Dirk and the army of pirates.
The battle swiftly began.
My Tele senses pinged way too late. Everything ain’t fine.
The planned Play Game from Dirk had succeeded for him, not for naïve Starra as he was the official royal diplomat on this royal mission under the direction of royal Prince Rann and his royal kingdom and his royal rules.
Also, Planet Sahara, with all the prisoners, and Planet Bio, with all clinical equipment, was owned and operated by only Lord Dirk, within the third alien timeline.


I mentally flashed back, within both the first and second alien timelines, when an assumed Emperor Dirk and his assumed Empress Rita destroyed Planet Resort bombarding wave after wave from red, yellow, and green colored maser power using a fleet of stolen ram starships on the property, planets, and people.


Then I flashed back present, Dirk had created a new home for his newly created race of novice Tele people, within his new empire, and now controlled the galaxy planets of Resort, Sahara. and Bio.
Lines of maser fire discharged out pretty streams of yellow, green, and red tinted damaging waves of bright light within the semi-dark room directly at my person, compliments of Dirk’s weapons arsenal also.
I performed a T-fly sideways and hid my person behind a nasty, red rust colored tall metal trash container blocking successfully a series of deadly waves. I continued to hover in the air and slapped both of my hands down over my new gray pretty diamond-stubbed soft cotton fabric top and matching skirt with a soft whine, nodding with a sour frown. “Great! No weapon again! This is such a bad habit, compliments of me.” I turned and sneered at Dirk, who had back peddled from the rows of pirate fighters, then crouched down against the entrance wall behind a tall mountain of hard tan colored rocks, within my eyesight but away from my short arm range. I sighed with impossibility.
I quickly performed a T-probe with my telepathy into Dirk’s mind and then understood completely.
Dirk had created a race of abnormal citizens who possessed a range of very limited Tele powers of telepathy and telekinesis, since each one of his created laboratory experiments had failed into forming a great Tele army for their evil leader.
The standing rows of short and tall pirates also had attacked and killed their own brothers and sisters inside the Bio ram ship under the direct order from Lord Dirk. I sighed with angry.
I sneered at Dirk and then returned, staring at an array of individual rust spots on the metal trash containers as a barge of individual medium and large rock chucks hit the container.
I must calm my internal angry and my jumbling nerve endings as my Tele powers will not work and wobble out of control, which will kill my person, within the third alien timeline.
I closed my two gray-tinted eyelashes at the metal container. Breathe in. Breathe out. Relax. Calm. Concentrate. Focus.
I was much calmer and in control now performing a T-scan with my telemetabolics, reaching out and touched each misshaped body on each pirate. Each pirate was missing numerous internal organs, as well as, each exterior limb, including a set of vocal cords for speech, one eyeball for sight, and a pair of ears for hearing. However, each one possessed and used the Tele power of telepathy as the primary form of communication for words and eyeballs to see. I sighed with pity.
The constant mind chatter inside my mind came from their individual telepathy words going to Dirk as I ease dropped on the conversation for my survival.
I turned and snarled at Dirk. He turned to see Starra with a grin and placed his index finger beside his temple.
Dirk had saved each pirate from the Sickness comatose state and then secretly transferred each one from the hospital bed on Space Station Bio inside one of the cold prison cells on Planet Sahara as part of his evil tele-experimentation. The row of short children and tall adult pirates did not, could not or would not see Dirk as a villain with his evil trick, only as a protector of their new society. I sighed with fury.
The air currents swiftly shifted and warned my senses that the stone toss was a little too high as the tiny rock fragment clipped my cheekbone with pain. “Ouch!” I smeared the fresh, hot red colored blood proteins over my golden freckles on my face using my hand while executing a Tele shield over my body, reflecting off each tiny tossed rock and stone and non-poisonous dart coming from each pirate on top of the high rock cliff. Each item flew in different direction through the air and then landed down on top of the stone floor at rest.
Then a bombardment of medium-sized rock fragments sailed through the air waves with a loud whistle coming towards my person and my Tele-shield. Behind the metal trash container, I lifted both of my arms in the air, within my shield, and performed a T-hold on each rock that prettily hung in the air over my hair roots for three seconds of drama. I split both of my arms as each rock chunk flew away from my body and slammed into the side wall with a set of loud booms, falling into millions of individual rock pieces in indigo and tan hue.
A second bombardment of both small and medium-sized rock fragments hit the upright dense and heavy red colored metal trash containers with numerous banging sounds, falling onto the stone floor in smaller pieces. Then the air waves stilled. I sighed with puzzlement.
A series of colorful yellow, red, green individual maser beams flew from each pirate on top of the high cliff as each one sizzled in hotness within the air current, coming directly at Starra.
“Really!” I executed a T-drop and then preformed a T-halt a few inches from the uneven stone floor as each maser ray hit and then melted the thick metal on the tall and wide trash container. Both the air waves and the metal container burned with heat inside the enclosed and damaged auditorium near my body and my face. I sweated like a plantation pig in the heat. I sighed with danger.
I slowly executed a T-drop on my horizontal body on top of the heated floor and pondered a new defensive strategy, since each pirate possessed a limited Tele power of telepathy for mental communications and limited Tele power of telekinesis for firing distance at my precious body.
Also, each pirate did not possess the vitally important Tele heal from the telemetabolics power which meant an instant death for each one, not for my body. However, Dirk did not possess the Tele power of healing telemetabolics, either. Thus, I mentally noted and stored for a future fight with Dirk later. I sighed with promise.
I continued to rest on top of the cool stone floor as a third bombardment of indigo colored large-sized rock fragments attacked and then attached onto the tall metal trash container that continued to heat and burn with more maser fire.
I closed my gray eyelashes. Breathe in. Breathe out. Relax. Concentrate. Calm. Focus.
I performed a T-probe with my telepathy counting five hundred pirates consisting of men, women, teens, and children on top of the high cliff. However, a team of one hundred muted and blind pirates slowly marched over the stone floor within a horizontal formation like good little warriors as they had been taught by a stupid Dirk. Each one fired out a colorful maser ray that melted and burned on the entrance rock wall while trying to touch my resting body behind the burning trash container.
I reinforced my T-shield with needy protection and turned to view Dirk. He was gone from the rock wall. However, I did not have time to find and kill him right now. I returned then viewed the line of pirates and performed a T-jerk from the floor with a loud sigh of annoyance, then executed a T-stand posing upright a few inches from the floor in the air with a huff, lifting both of my arms in the air. I reached out and performed a T-grab at one of the tall garage containers scooting it over the uneven stone floor with a terrible grinding sound that made my teeth ache. I executed a T-toss with my telekinesis at the advancing line consisting of men, women, and teenager pirate as my two Tele nose holes smelled the fear and then my pair of Tele eardrums heard the loud yells of panic on each dying or dead pirate. Then, a second line of men, women, and teen pirates shuffled down the high cliff coming towards my body.
“Geez! Everyone wants to die today,” I whispered for my eardrums only. I sighed with sadness.
I linked, connected, and Tele talked to Dirk: You are next on my hit list, Dirk. Watch out!
Dirk linked, connected, and then Tele talked back Starra: Only if you survive, Starra!
The line of determined and manipulated poor creatures, not really humans, slowly approached my position behind the burning trash container and then pressed a button and fired out a colorful maser ray at the entrance rock wall while trying to kill Starra.
At the same time, on top of the high cliff, numerous rows of creatures continued to toss a larger-sized rock formation at Starra, who hid behind the burning trash containers.
I turned and performed a T-pace moving through the air wave back and forth behind the burning metal trash containers as the poor metal object was continuously belted with rock objects and maser fire rays.
Peace. Peace. Peace. I linked, connected, and Tele talked to each pirate.
Die. Die. Die. The collective mind from each pirate mind linked, connected, and Tele talked back to Starra.
I whipped away the sweat from my worried face rubbing down to my wet throat, fearing the emotions within my head and my heart. Each pirate was a victim here coming from a captured prison bed. I sighed with defeat.
A massive rock boulder sailed through the air with a loud whistle coming from the combined strength of fifty pirates and nosily smashed into the burning trash container, before my eyesight and in front of my air-borne body. I sighed with wow-ness.
I swiftly performed a sideway T-leap from the air and then landed down on the stone floor with a loud groan, saving my body, still wearing my Tele shield. I folded into a ball and stay behind the mount of rock, where Dirk had been hidden, before he had vanished into the air, or maybe the woodwork.
I performed a T-grab with numerous loose rock fragments and thick loose slabs of dark blue colored concrete, creating my own set of home-made weapons and then executed a T-toss reaching in mass, pelting each pirate into a short pile of wet bones, blood, and flesh. I sighed with death.
I slowly stood upright from the stone floor with a growl, then executed a T-walk up the bank of tan colored rock in the air waves and finally halted on top of the uneven floor, staring down at my new enemy with a loud sneer of annoyance and more death acts. I sighed with brutality.
Inside the damaged archway on the entrance wall that led into the enclosed and destroyed dance hall auditorium, Lord Dirk quietly squats down on top of the even stone floor with a smile and stares at Starra’s Tele performance, whispering for his eardrums only. “I knew that girl possessed too many Tele powers, which is more than I. I have eye witnessed her Tele strength of telekinesis and heard her telepathy talents. She has always possessed Tele healing from telemetabolics like Rosa as Starra is always healed and lovely, after each dangerous and deadly encounter with my blade. Now, I wonder if she possesses the tele power of teleclairvoyance. No matter now! I will never know the full truth as trouble is approaching from the east,” he scooted backwards from the archway and then stood upright, leaning into the side wall inside the hallway while pointing at the open archway with a worried brow.
Coming down the even stone hallway, Rann appeared alone with a stern face and swiftly raced ahead to Dirk, wondering about his princess bride Starra, scanning the immediately damaged hallway with worry.
“Rann!” Dirk turned and waved a friendly hand at the prince with a slick smirk, standing beside the side wall.
Rann stopped and stared at Dirk with a sneer. “Starra! I see you, Dirk. So, where is Starra? Is she harmed? How you harmed her?” He reached down and touched outlying his maser on the utility belt around his fitted waistline while still snarling at Dirk.
Dirk continued to stand and laughed out loud. “No, I am not harmed. No, Starra is not harmed either. And she is located inside the forward dance hall auditorium which is ahead of us. Come close and see Starra, should we, Rann?”
He turned and stared into the open archway seeing only darkness with faint lights and loud noises, “Why is Starra there without you, Dirk?”
Dirk laughed again. “It was her choice, really!”
He gasped in shock and dashed ahead toward the archway, shouting out loud with worry. “Starra! I must save her.” Rann drew out his maser and stopped taking a step into the unknown room with worry and concern.
Dirk dashed ahead and scooted sideways, blocking Rann, leaning down into the nose bridge on Rann with a stern face and a whisper. “Don’t go inside yet, prince! Don’t you wanna know what is happening inside, Rann. Your royal life is in danger here also. Your girl, Starra has started a fight with the society of pirates here on damaged Resort, Rann.”
Rann growled with alarm and jerked out his maser, placing the cold weapon barrel at the invisible heart organ on Dirk’s chest.
“Watch and learn, prince!” Dirk back stepped from Rann with laughter, without fear, spinning around to face the damaged hotel room, advancing a few feet away from Rann and then halted, staring at Starra with a soft chuckle and a smile.
Rann continued to hold the maser at the back spine on Dirk, feeling puzzlement, then slowly moved ahead while scanning the damaged room and then halted with curiosity. He climbed the small mountain of tan colored rock and stood beside Dirk, aiming the maser at air waves while watching and listened to the loud commotion.
On top of the taller mountain peak made of solid tan colored rock, I rolled my body sideways over the dirty floor and moved to the side wall, performing a T-lift with my telekinesis on the next burnt and battered red colored trash containers that stood in a crooked row. I executed a T-toss in the air and then performed a T-squash down on two rows of advancing pirates that were firing strings of colorful maser waves at my precious body but missed. I gasped for air and frowned with a whisper. “Geez, Louise! These things don’t stop walking, continue fighting, and just keep advancing to me like their loving mama, which I ain’t. I terribly fear the killing time of each pirate has not ended yet.” I sighed with taskness.
Near the open archway, on top of a smaller mountain of tan colored rock beside Dirk, Prince Rann pointed at the commotion and gasped in shock, staring at Starra, whispering to Dirk. “What! What am I seeing here? What is happening in here?”

My Tele senses pinged. Everything ain’t fine.
Rann did not speak but flipped his hand to the side. Each human and metal guard bowed down to the Ruler of the Universe, slowly back stepping from Rann like he was mad at something or someone. He exhaled with annoyance. “Starra, how are you feeling?” He slowly shuffled ahead and twenty inches from Dirk, faking a smile, then stopped, reaching out, touching her naked forearm.
Maybe, I should have worn the ancient gray dress with a pair of long sleeves. I shifted my arm back into my chest and away from his warm hand. Rann continued to fake a smile and examined her exposed, healthy non-cut, non-damaged naked skin tissue. I sighed with deep trouble.
“Fine!” I played down my awesome Tele powers of healing telemetabolics and slightly leaned around the upright body on Rann, eye burning Dirk. Dirk continued to stand in place and produced a wicked smile with a soft chuckle like a girl, staring at Starra. I sighed with deep concern.
Rann reached out and touched, caressing her other forearm that held smooth un-cut, non-damaged naked skin tissue, also, saying with puzzlement. “You are healed on your naked arms. “It wasn’t a…”
“You displayed numerous wound injuries on your biological body. You also refused to see a medical Bbot. Now, I can’t believe my two normal eyes. I see with my eye that your naked skin tissue does not contain a single skin cut or a blue bruise or a tissue scar. How is this all possible, Starra?” He dropped down her limb and looked up with a stern face, staring at Starra. Then he twisted his face and viewed Dirk. Dirk turned and nodded in silence back to Rann.
My Tele senses pinged. Everything ain’t fine, darling!
I continued to stand and then witnessed that slick head move coming from Dirk.
His face returned and produced a fake smile to Starra. “I was also amazed with your fantastical feats yesterday on the destroyed planet of Resort. Would you mind explaining, to me, something? How you were able to throw numerous heavy objects weighing tons of poundage from one side of a wide ballroom to the other side, without the use of bot machine power?” His face twisted from Starra and viewed Dirk.
My Tele senses pinged. Everything ain’t fine, darling!
Dirk nodded with a stern face to Rann. “The answer is so simple, Rann. She is an alien.” He turned and laughed at Starra, “Are you an alien, Starra?”
I continued to stand and gasped in alarm, staring with a stern face of mixed angry emotions at Dirk, in silence.

Starra has come here to invade and destroy our universe, Rann. She comes from Planet Earth within the Milky Way Galaxy. Planet Earth is dying. Starra is an Earthling, coming from Planet Earth, within the Milky Way Galaxy. Don’t deny it, Starra! Is that even your real Earth name?” Rann did not gasp or speak or huff or hiss at the new information.
I continued to stand and gasped in alarm, without a word, and as my two gray tinted pupils darted to Rann and then returned to Dirk. I sighed with deadly danger.
Dirk smiled only at Starra. “Ask her how old she is? Earthlings are younger than we. You cannot tell by their physical appearance as the other side of daily events, on the wormhole, moves much slower than our universe. Starra will give you the wrong answer, Rann.”
I continued to stand and gasped in shock. I am 17 years, 7 months, 7 days, 7 hours, 7 minutes, and 7 seconds old in Earth years, not Commerce time.
My Tele senses pinged. Everything ain’t fine, darling!


I mentally flashed back past, within the first and second alien timelines, when Lady Rosa had been an ancient 249 years of age.

Lord Dirk had been a young 72 years of age.

Then I mentally flashed into the present day, I did not know Rann’s age. He could be 17 years old or 27 years old or 57 years old or 77 years or 97 years or 107 years of age. I sighed with confusion.
I grinned and flirted with my two eyelashes swaying both of my hips as my long gown shuffled sideways. I cleared my throat from the bitter bile and then parted my lips to speak a strand of sweet words to my upcoming husband-prince.
“What is your age, Starra?” Rann snarled at the alien from Planet Earth.
My Tele senses pinged. Everything ain’t fine.

The third alien timeline was going so well and then I encountered Dirk.

Alien Day 99


Ancient warehouse location
Dark blue sky, black clouds,100% precipitation of rain at 67ºF


I continued to perform my Tele run at twenty miles-per-hour on top of wet mud, in the cold rain storm, coming from the exploded space shuttle. Yeah, I had slapped the self-destruct button, before racing away from the upcoming destruction. I had to destroy and hide the earthling evidence from all the aliens.

Wait! I’m the alien here.

I dashed ahead all wet and annoyed, racing onto the damaged front porch as the soggy wooden floor gave way to the heavy object, which was my body. I wobbled sideways on my two booted feet breaking through the rotten wooden planks, drowning down into the mud puddle below the porch.
I stood in mud and looked up at a rotten moldy entrance door, tossing the coat of wet rain drops from my tired body, feeling the chill in the cold air waves and deeply desired a hot beverage and a hotter bath. I performed a Tele lift from the wet mud and heard the funny glump-glump sound, executing an air-walk through the waves towards the warped door, reaching out and touched the rusty metal door knob. I sighed with daydreaming.
I am an earthling, who is named Starra Starbelt, measuring five feet and one inch in height, weighing 95 pounds and one ounce and displayed a head of long waist length silver hair against a triangular-shaped face with a pair of small eye sockets and a pair of gray-tinted eyeballs. I possess a pointy nose and two high cheekbones around a cliff-shaped chin bone, which is surrounded with golden tawny skin tissue and decorated with numerous brown colored freckles. I am seventeen years old and a farm administrator from Planet Earth.
I had been drafted, by force, by Tele leader Peter Martin into the once in a life-time intergalactic outer space trip finding a new planet, within a new galaxy, using my awesome set of Tele powers, consisting telepathy, telekinesis, telemetabolics, and teleclairvoyance.

And I, now, have survived alone.

I continued to stand in front of the moldy entrance door and blinked both of my gray-tinted eyelashes back into the new reality, shaking the bangs from my two eyeballs, sneering with annoyance. I lifted my boot heel in the air and slammed it into the middle space on the rotten white colored entrance door as the door creaked like a haunted house then nicely fell backward away from my air-borne and upright petite body while the door died laying down in a white path of dust bunnies and killed them dead. I sighed with awesomeness.
I moved ahead and performed an air-walk maneuver through the open archway, into an empty room, dancing around of some live moving white dust bunnies in the air. Rann had a mother and a father, commoners. They owned and operated a small fishing boat expedition on planet Resort, carrying the tourists into the green blue tinted ponds for fishing.

“The accident was quick and painless,” echoed by Marquis Roy, the noble of Resort at the funeral of both Rann’s parents, who were killed instantly. The old engines on the older sea boat shifted into a high-speed gear and then swiftly ramped into the solid coral seaside wall.

Rann inherited a small two-bedroom apartment located in one of the many casino hotel suites and a smaller curr account. Roy offered him a paying job at the one of the casino hotels on the other side of town.

Rann accepted the good deal as a young and ambitious teenage of sixteen years old. Since, he was born and reared on planet Resort. While under his parent’s guidance, he had visited the casino before when his father needed to borrow currs for a financial loan to repair the old boat.

As a new employee, he watched and studied the daily Conqueror tournament games for six months. No citizen could walk into the casino, playing a few hands of cards and then leave with a million currs inside a trouser pocket.

Rann enjoyed playing the Conqueror game as often as he could afford the games. Bluffing was the easy part of the game for Rann, while currs was the hard part. He didn’t have enough currs to play and pay the high monetary bets with the nobles or the professional gamblers.

One or two bad card hands would cause a Conqueror player to lose everything in a flash of a second.

After six months of employment with Marquis Roy, Rann was promoted to the position of senior programmer on the mainframe computer network, which happened to control all the Conqueror robot, or the nickname Cbot for every casino on the planet of Resort.

The gambling robots were impossible to re-program. Embedded security codes and encrypted passwords controlled the bots, except for a backdoor access code. The backdoor access code was secretly maintained by a hand-full of selected and restricted senior programmers that were created for entrance into a Cbot during an emergency.

And the pass code was changed every five hours for strict security by a different senior programmer, while on duty. The senior programmers traced and recorded every error, virus, and fraudulent felony against the gambling casinos.

Rann had deviously changed the secret password from the previous senior programmer on his shift late, four hours ago.

The time was the eighth hour of the evening. And all the guests were retiring for the late evening. Rann secretly had created a new illegal Conqueror card program, testing his new bot skill. Then he won the solo Conqueror game, collecting all the currs that night.

Rann waited for a chance to play for a bigger jackpot with Cbot. He had programmed that targeted robot to lose every other card hand to the hotel guest, not the house. Then Rann would win every other card hand.

The time was the tenth hour of the evening, midnight. The casino closed at midnight, so every worker could go home to rest for the work day.

The Conqueror jackpot totaled 25,000 currs. There were two players and the infected Cbot with Rann’s new illegal bot subroutines.

Cbot was programmed to lose the next round of the Conqueror game. Rann held three of a kind in the numerical figure of sevens, a winning hand.

The other player shouted the word, call, to end the game, dropping off the card hand into the metal glass slot for auditing.

Cbot droned. “Three kings, the winning card hand. Player number two wins the Conqueror game and 25,000 curr jackpot.”

Rann had finished with his work shift for the evening, exiting out the casino too, heading back to his small apartment at another hotel on the other side of town. He turned the building corner to see.

Rann was mad, upset, and angry.

In the dark alley way, Rann stood and stopped, attacking. He shoved the male against the hard wall of the hotel.

I picked out and sat down in an empty seat within the crowded room elbowing the other pointy elbows on my right side then my left side among the laughing teenagers. I sighed with boredom.

He nodded with a smile, “Welcome! I am your king.” Dirk was ruler of the universe. I sighed with fear.
“This is not my day!” I whispered for my eardrums only and continued to stare softly sneering at my number one enemy of the universe.


I mentally flashed backwards, within the fifth alien timeline, when Dirk was king also, during the new never created Royal Carnival, and caused major trouble for me, with Rann, in which, I didn’t become married or finish that alien timeline, before dying again.


Then I mentally flashed present, within the sixth alien timeline, staring with a low growl at my one number enemy.

I commend each one of you for attending and completing your difficult homework assignment and your school activities.” He poses and pauses as each student nosily clapped and cheered for the king. I did not cheer or clap but sneered for the reigning king. He continued in his dull monotone of alto timber. “I guess you are wondering why and what your person is doing here. You are to become tested and then assigned a working job with currs here within my universal kingdom which lies throughout the various global planets, based on your next set of examination scores.”
Weird-o! Within the previous five alien timelines, which I have been completely messed up, which is beside the point, each citizen is birthed then dies on their home planet, without the chance of any type of future travel plans for allowing for a different career promotion on a different planet.
I did not move my head and sliced my two eyeballs studying each one of my citizen buddies on the same hard bleacher bench, who appeared like a group of young, naive teenagers, then I smiled while nodding my bone skull at King Dirk’s command, in silence. I sighed with puzzlement.
Get this! I am a classified as a student, which means, I receive currs, shelter, and food, without working, instead of charity or jail. Believe me! I have experienced both a lousy work job and a terrible time in jail throughout the five alien timelines. I sigh with victory.

Planet Agri is nicknamed the Farm Planet and is colored in dull greens for forest, dull reds for crop lands, and dull blues for fresh water rivers and lakes. The world produces domestic animals for pets and work jobs plus farm animals for food, numerous crop fields for food and materials for clothes and furniture, and seafood from the fresh water rivers and lakes.
The group of teenagers were guided by one of the Business Associates, without a name, wearing a dirty-looking tan colored one-piece jumpsuit, walking between rows of yellow tinted corn stalks on one side and flat pasture lands with herds of black and white grazing cows on the opposite side, running over a smooth red tinted dirt road into a square-shaped log house with a row of open windows, without the glass panes. The line of newly graduated young teenagers stopped and formed a semi-crooked line from the open doorway, over the dirt to the end, where Starra stood with a smile of curiosity. Each student entered the small structure then disappeared into the dark room.
I was next and moved through the open door, quickly fanning away each drifting plume of heated steam from my wet face. The interior room smelled of fresh pine tree scent and looked like true chopped pine tree logs with its exposed tree rings presenting a narrow floor plan. One side held a work counter in smooth wooden pine and a row of workers, guarding a line of clothing items.

“I prefer the color of gray matching my hair strands.” I reached up and touched one of the curly tips on my gray tinted locks and smiled brightly.

Parted clouds with sunrays and 75°F

I stood in line within the humid weather and sweated within my new outfit, whispering for my eardrums only, “This ain’t my day.” I sighed with annoyance. A pair of stranger palms shoved my body forward into a loose huddle of teens.
Each teen watched a male adult, who wore a blue tinted, neatly ironed and nicely pressed military uniform. He did not smile but stated, holding up a set of big colorful star-shaped objects. “You will receive a colorful star, today, based on your single test performance. Red star is bad. Yellow star is repeat. Green star is good.”
“Green hue for go. Yellow hue for cautious. And red hue for stop.” I mumbled too loudly then softly sniggered at the upcoming teenly test.

I sneered at the instructor, “Little girl!” I sighed with confidence.
Four targets were perched at 500 feet, then 1,000 feet, then 1,500 feet, and finally 2,000 feet apart slightly scattered among the flat dirt ground, within my acute eyesight and away from my teenly body. He did not stare at Starra but extended his hand, placing a golden star on top of her palm for her exceptional weapons test.
I giggled with a grin and shuffled my sash over my chest, grabbing the sticky golden tinted star, pasting the item onto the satiny sash. I spun around to face the stunned crowd of teens then slowly strolled back into the huddle, spinning around and laughed out loud. I sighed with pride.

Property of General Ivan

The dead planet from numerous bomb attacks without the radiation residue was slowly coming back to life. The mammals had not returned, but small pods of fresh fruit and pretty wildflower plants were spouting up from the sandy ground at knee-high level. Rann had established his settlement near the ocean waters, where the bright sunrays warmed both the plants and the people, occupying the damaged, not destroyed buildings. The rest of the planet was comprised of greenish tinted waters and grayish tinted land masses, where the burnt landscape was healing and trying to thrive. Rann had both used and abused asteroid Resort during the previous alien timelines, for some reason. I really didn’t have time or didn’t care to find out Rann’s purpose, only marry the man and live the rest of my days happily here or there or anywhere within the unknown galaxy.
Leaving the grounded ship ramp first, walking into the nighttime humid air currents, staring up at the pretty stars, I knew the secret location of the target based on the instructions in the mini-bot and hiked one mile to a food grocery store without purchasing one single item then stopped, staring at Dirk’s rejects…naw…snarfs.

You try and figure that word out.

Each one of the snarfs dropped down falling on top of each other and their hand gun over the white tinted sand grains, slowly crawling on the ground towards the target building. Captain Warrior was a tall, muscular young adult leading the other snarfs while whispering through the helmet comfone to each warrior. “Plant each bomb near the…”
I could hear within my two Tele-eardrums the soft whispers then shouted into the shared comfone, without the helmet, “Wait!” I studied the damaged but occupied building.
“For what?” Captain Warrior continued to crawl over the sand grains and sounded back with a growl at his commander.
I smiled at the building. “You are to wait on my order, Captain Warrior. I’m the commander leader right here and right now.” I performed a Tele probe with my telepathy without crawling over the sands, standing on top of the sands, executing a Tele scan inside the building walls, in the far distance. I could see shelves and stacks of dry and wet fresh food items, dangerous weapons, ratty but clean uniforms, numerous medical supplies, good bot equipment, a few mini-bots, broken furniture pieces, a few office desks, and human personnel. “Stang!” I whispered for my eardrums. No prisoners, the two words were shouted out loud by an angry king going into my two eardrums, before I left his throne room. So, I am going to interpret his stupid kingly statement that no body or bodies are captured by the team while each body continues to breath in fresh air currents.
I ordered into the comfone, “Plant the bombs on the southeastern and northwestern wall corners on the damaged structure.”
“We have more explosives which can cover all four geographical locations, commander.” One of the male eager-to-kill military soldiers whispered inside his comfone back to his supervisors.
I frowned. “Well, I like that idea. However, there are working citizens in the front of the building.”
“Workers! How many workers?” Captain Warrior continued to crawl over the sands.
“Six.” I answered and continued to stand while watching Captain Warrior.
“How does she know that?” A female military solider whispered into the comfone.
“Beats me! We don’t have modern radar for that type of scan.” A second male soldier continued to crawl over the sands heading towards the target building.
“We should invade the facility then kill them all.” Captain Warrior growled into the comfone since he was monster, like his king. I sighed with punishment.
“Finish planting the bombs and wait for my command, Captain! Do I make myself clear?” I sneered with bodily harm to the snarf.
“Yes sir!” He continued to crawl over the sands and headed to one of the selected geographical walls by Starra.
I continued to stand and exhaled with annoyance, starting to run over the sands at an angle from the ammunition team in the darkness of the moonlight. I hoped that Rann didn’t have a scouting team. Else I would become identified and then captured. Dirk would become angry.
A second female on the team turned to see the ghostly figure over the sands. “Where is she going?”
“I don’t know, but Starra better be going to eliminate these live and breathing six food workers, before the building explodes and one of them escapes and tattles to Rann. Or it is else for her!” Captain warrior continued to crawl and laughed out loud. I sighed with trouble.
I heard that nasty statement. Thus, I might be eliminating an officer or two within my own army, before this mission ends. I disappeared behind the large semi-tilted building out of sight from the team members then stopped at the front entrance of the structure, using my telepathy, hearing a set of laughter from each worker, inside the front room. Then I connected, linked and Tele talked to each food employee: Hungry! Food! Go!
Inside the front room, a male voice yelled out loud, “Hey, boys and girls! I’m hunger. Dinner and drinks on me tonight!” He led his five workers towards the closed front door while more laughter of humor and left the food warehouse building, making lots of noises consisting of low booms and loud bangs. The set of workers entered three different air ships, safely leaving the area, without harm or injury.
I continued to watch and monitor the delicate situation, whispering for my eardrums only, “No bodies.” I sniggered with delight then spun around, performing a Tele dash using my telekinesis down the same dark building wall, into the open sands, racing through the moonlight back towards my original position a few feet from the grounded carrier ship. I stood and shouted into the comfone to each team member, who was slowly crawling like a row of worms back towards the carrier ship and safe from the upcoming explosion. “Do it, too it!” Someone hit the button on the device. The tall, semi-tilted damaged building exploded into an array of rainbow colors consisting of yellow, pink, green, orange, red, and blue hue creating a grand display of pretty fireworks, for both King Dirk and Prince Rann. I sighed with accomplishment.

Actually, I really do not care to know, and prefer to work my job on a need-to-know basis. I sighed with duty. I shook my curls with worry then spun around, viewing the classroom monitor with Dirk. “That’s does not make any sense to my neurons, Gbot.” I stared at the comlen looking for trouble, for action, and for a fight, since Rann would kick Dirk’s fanny in a heartbeat, if Rann entered the same classroom. “Naw! Forget it!” I laughed out loud then spun away from the window using my telepathy, mentally thinking within my mind: This was the end of the ship tour. “A joke.” I shouted back to Dirk.
“What joke?”
“The one on you.” I laughed out loud and entered the open door on an empty elevator carriage without spinning away from the rear wall of smooth, cold metal. Inside the empty hallway, King Dirk slowly padded ahead with a set of loud sneers. The elevator door closed set as I laughed out loud again.

“I’ll call you.” I exited the throne room and moved into the outer room.
“Is that more of your witty Earth humor?” He smiled.
“That’s an old Earth expression.” I moved into the busy hallway returning home. I sighed with annoyance.

Two days later….


Alien Day 119


Planet Commerce location
Cool temperatures and bright sunlight
6th hour (sun rise)


I had enjoyed my two days of peace, quiet, and harmony at my borrowed home, without seeing Dirk. But that all changed during the early morning sunshine, on the sixth hour, when I was connected, linked, and then Tele talked by Dirk through our shared minds while ordering my person awaken. I had arrived on the seventh hour at the royal castle, for a new work day.
I slept almost until the seventh hour then leaped up from my messy bed mattress wearing the same wrinkled dirty military uniform, performing a Tele dash from my borrowed castle then executed a Tele jump from the dry dirt, through the air waves, and landed down in the cockpit of my zipper ship on the tenth level floor balcony of the royal castle. I sighed with brilliance.
Then I wiggled around the leather seat and performed a tiny hand wave move at Dirk. He exited the secret staircase then entered his royal carrier ship, blasting off first. I sighed with revenge.
Yeah, I had to follow him and the plume of white stream, of course.


Space Station Uni location
Cold dark outer space minus 1000°F
7th hour (mid-morning)


Dirk led through the quiet outer space waves then landed inside the interior docking bay of metal Space Station Uni first, parking his transport on the side wall without other vehicles. I parked my zipper ship beside his then opened the cockpit hatch, jumping down from the pilot’s seat, slowly padding beside Dirk. We entered the same metal hallway of silver tinted metal. The hallway was empty without citizens or robots. I scanned each wall, the floor, the ceiling, and then Dirk, looking at his chest level, since I was too short to see his snarl. I chuckled with amusement, “What! No body guards today.”
He continued to slowly pad ahead with a grand smile, “I do not need them. I have you. We’re going on a royal tour today. But I am only going to visit Space Station Uni, not perform the whole Tour of the Planets exhibition.” Dirk used Starra’s cleverly created term. I sighed with pride.
“We just did that thing last week.” I frowned. “Why only Uni today?”
“Only the kids, the little monsters are really a true measure of my success.”
I tossed both of my arms in the air then halted beside the open archway of the control room. “I know. I know. I know. Go and watch inside the comlen room again.” I turned and faced the dark room filled with brightly lit comfones, comlens, and robots, slowly entering the darkness. Dirk laughed out loud and slowly moved ahead, entering the same fourth grade classroom from last week. I rushed into one of the empty chairs and sat down, watching the monitor inside the fourth-grade classroom, gasping in shock and awe.
Each elementary student wore a neatly ironed and nicely pressed blue tinted tiny military uniform with a purple tinted sash either located around the childish waistline or chest. Dirk appeared inside the archway. Then the group of kids ceased the loud commotion, sitting down, staring at Dirk.
Inside the comfone room, I continued to sit and gasped in alarm and awe, without words.

Rann continued to stand appearing stoic, calm and serene like a true gentleman on the unknown universe with a fake smile.

Then you will be awarded by me, your king.” The standing kids started an array of loud cheers, whistles, hoots, foot stomps, and claps for Dirk. I sighed with shock.

Please sit down, students!” Each standing child slowly sat back down, obeying the robot teacher, staring at Dirk. “The young faces were teenagers and pre-teens, who were estimated between eleven to nineteen years of age.”

Rann eats it himself. Did you know this place used to a hotel building? Rann does everything to feed, house, and shelter us, during this silly Civil War.”

Your once nicely ironed and neatly pressed military uniform is going to get hot and heated on your sweating body. I will find something else for you to wear, since you are going to be our guest for a while per Rann’s orders.”
My ripped and torn wool uniform was hot and itchy against my healing body.
Rita continued to stare at Starra with a fake smile. “I usually don’t compliment a citizen. I don’t like you, but I’m making an exception in this case. You are very beautiful. I can see Rann’s fascination with you. Know this, sweetie! He is mine! I will kill for that man.” She hissed then faked a smile. “Ivan finds you to be a competent and brilliant warrior with the war strategy. I told him that Dirk is the brains. But Ivan insists giving you some credit for your vicious implementation of intimidating and then eliminating the enemy. After all, you have managed to blow up quite a few of our food and supply and equipment facilities minus the citizen deaths. A king needs a general, isn’t that correct?” She nodded with a soft chuckle. “I’m complimenting you. Aren’t you going to say something back?” She exhaled with annoyance. “There aren’t many nobles left in the universe. Dirk controls all the planets on his other side of the Wall. If Rann did not own the planet of Sahara, the war would be over. He is worth trillions of currs and can buy anything he wants. Tok hates your guts, but he does admit that he respects your rank. A woman leading an army. You do rate high in his book on that.”
Tok was very direct noble using both his emotions and insights towards people, places, and pets. He did not play games or mutter insignificant antidotes. I liked Tok and respected his brute strength and sharp mind as six feet and seven inches noble male, when he was not intoxicated with spirits of delight.
“Don’t I get a thank you or at least a nod!” She laughed. “Enjoy your day, Commander!” Rita slowly back stepped from the room while still watching Starra, slamming the door shut without a fight or a body injury. She was still well-mannered, mean, and vile. I sighed with death.
I deeply, truly loved Rann but I could not help him, since he did not seem to love me, but wanted to use me for his personal gain. I hated Dirk but couldn’t kill him. Geez! I scratched my healing sweaty body beneath the ripped wool fabric. I sighed with heat.
I stood from the bed then padded to the open window, feeling more heat while calculating the angle of the solar sun shadow which was close to eight in the morning and sweated like a plantation pig. My uniform was ruined, after tearing both of long sleeves completely off each collar bone, ripping the high neck collar off the jacket. I cleared more of the hot fabric from my wet neck removing my boots. I sighed with doom.
I was not traveling anywhere soon, if I understood Rann’s warning and Rita’s explanation. “Time to dance for the rest of the night!” He released her hand then stood upright, sliding off the chair, assisting Starra to stand.

“Exactly!”

“To reveal my spies...”

Alien Day 128

Note: A Tele trance of healing only works when I engage the Tele talent, not voluntarily.

I closed my gray tinted eyelashes. Breathe in. Breathe out. Calm. Relax. Concentrate. Focus.
Using my telemetabolics, I performed a Tele scan on my aching body, noting a head concession.
Rita possessed an accurate pitching arm, if not incompetent with a deadly weapon. She had threatened to kill Starra three different tries and then failed using the deadly weapon.
I am still alive, if not for the efforts of my man Rann, saving my life. I sigh with true love.
Using my telemetabolics, I cleared all the fuzzy and dizzy sensations from each tingling neuron first slowly moving down touching each cell, blood vessel, and organ then feeling a healthy, not injured body. My Tele talents started warming up my freezing-cold body temperature into a normal biological stage that quickly started melting the hard ice cubes. I sighed with hotness.
I slowly turned my face seeing a long and wide rectangular-shaped room in white hue, smelling the sterile crisp antiseptic odors mixed with the cold air molecules. My mysterious bed with cold water was positioned a few feet from the entrance wall.
The entrance wall contained a single closed door near the wall corner then a solid wall of white paint, and finally the mysterious bed of cold water. I frowned with confusion at my new location, which was not my old hotel room, turning my face, quickly scanning my new prisoner room. Each long side wall was empty without book shelves, furniture pieces, nice wall decorations, or a single glass window that exposed the time of day or night. However, my Tele talents tattled within my body it was the eighth hour of an early morning of a new day. I sighed with information.
The rear wall held nothing but more white tinted paint. However, I greatly desired to explore and wander about my new room, without a bodyguard, in robot or flesh format.
I jerked my non-dominate arm in the air then gasped in shock, scanning my limb, seeing a metal cuff on my wrist bone that was attached to the left-side metal railing on the ugly U-shaped bed frame. My metal cuff was linked to a long metal chain at the left-side metal leg on the ugly U-shaped bed frame, which appeared like a hospital bed, not a regular sleeping bed frame. The ugly U-shaped bed frame stood a few feet from the clean hard tile floor in solid white hue without a speckle of dark or light dirt or dust bunnies. I signed with impressive.
This place was one of the damaged but upright hotel buildings that had been destroyed during one of the numerous Civil Wars within the first alien timeline. Thus, this Civil War was a continuous battle for rule or reign of the galaxy which was always started by Dirk and his side kick Rita while killing off as many nobles as possible. Dirk and Rita had succeeded too.
My new environment was an enclosed room without a single glass window exposing the sunlight and the outside elements. Thus, my eyeballs, my eardrums, my nose holes, and my mind did not know the time or place or weather conditions. However, my awesome Tele talents relayed all the new information within seconds inside my regular senses.
“The time ticks towards the eighth hour of a new morning with dark blue skies and heavy sheets of raindrops at 76 percent precipitation and 65 degrees Fahrenheit. Today is not a nice day for a picnic with Rann,” I grinned with a giggle. I sighed with silliness.
This room was part of the hotel building which was located on a different floor. I realized that the old hotel building had to house a medical ward for an injured hiker or water skier or drunken gambler, so this was the spot for medical services.


I mentally flashed back in the past, within the first alien timeline, I had visited a healthier Planet Resort.

The world featured tons of lush pale and dark green colored forests of trees, scrubs, and wild animal life forms. The soil was black tinted for hiking. The pale green tinted waters were clean for numerous fun sports activities.

Each paved street without an air space displayed fun colors of orange, yellow, green, blue, red, pink, purple, and more on the neon signs. The signs advertised fun games, glittery merchandise, big hotels, and good smelling eateries.

Lines of happy men, women, teenagers, children and elderly citizens formed numerous fun parades dancing to the jazzy musical song, singing off-key, marching towards one of the tall and glittering hotel buildings for a day in the sea waters or a night in the gambling casinos.

The planet offered a fun, adventurous relaxing time for all families including one lost alien.


Then I mentally flashed present and stared at the long side wall in white hue, exhaling with defeat, disappointment, and sorrow. “All of that is gone now due to Dirk! I have caused this mess and lost my best friend, my future husband, and my man,” I growled in fury. “You are next on my death list, Dirk!” I looked down and examined my bruised wrist bone, my new metal bracelet, and the long chain on the floor pondering a new escape plan with dire complications. Then I heard a set of faint voices. Correction there! I heard a set of faint breathing sounds producing a long steady, subtle, low, slow breath. Something was inside the room with me. I sighed with panic.
I slowly turned to face the opposite side of the room and focused my eyesight on an object that blended into white wall, quickly jerking my arm with the metal cuff in the air that restricted my limited distance while getting a better view of the mysterious object, yelling in pain, “Ouch!” I examined my collar bone, which was hard to do as it existed beyond my eyeballs. However, my collar bone from the ceiling heated particles was still recovering from my first healing touch and displayed an array of ugly brightly tinted pink gooey blisters which were slowly popping open and caused some minor pain within my body.

I am not a perfect, ya’ll!

I closed my two gray tinted eyelashes. Breathe in. Breathe out. Relax. Calm. Concentrate.
I performed a Tele heal using my telemetabolics on every blister popping each one, spurting the body fluid in the air that splatter on the clean sterile white tinted wall paint. I quickly mended each shallow hole and ripped the skin tissue over the dent producing a layer of pink tinted healing skin on my wounded collar bone. By the end of the day, after applying bouts of healing talents, my skin will heal into a light tan hue. I really needed to suntan getting back my glowing golden tone. I sighed with sunlight.
I opened my eyelids and stared down at the wet dress which was not dirty but torn in spots, exhaling with healthy sensations, looking back at the mysterious object across the room. I sighed with scared excitement.
I slowly stood upright on my wet kneecaps in the calm water making small waves, banging the linked chain rope on the bed railing, clearly seeing the object on the side wall. And my eyeballs quickly adjusted to the dimmer lighted lamps on that side of the room also. I sighed with danger.
I didn’t want to perform a mental Tele probe which might accidentally awaken the sleeping monster that was barely breathing in pain or trouble. I was a trapped and helpless prisoner also inside this cold room.
I performed a Tele grab lifting the chain off the floor in the air waves slowly standing upright inside the metal floor on the U-shape bed of heated water, lengthening the chain to its maximum distance and ripped more of the gala gown. I still could not distinguish the thing inside the object. I sighed with frustration.

My hemline on my dress dragged then ripped off in long fabric pieces from the shuffling the chain then getting eaten up and spat out by the four rotating wheels on the bed frame. I could view a shiny piece of glass on the object that appeared in the shape a coffin then halted. I sighed with inquisitiveness.
Someone had died within their dead body which was resting in the same room with Starra.

I still could not see the monster due to the mathematical angle of the bed from the wall and moved closer to the coffin, hearing a set of faint noises from the exterior hallway walls. The faint noise was getting closer producing a series of loud sounds near the locked and closed door. I sigh with huge inquisitiveness.
I wanted to see the monster before another life form released the thing into my enclosed room. I sighed with fear.

Rann clearly rested inside that glass coffin and was clearly dead. I sighed with sorrow.
Rann will not come back to see me into the current alien timeline or any of the future alien timelines, if I die in this one. Once dead, always gone! He will live but die again in the next alien timeline. He will live and never marry me but continue to die in each newly created alien timeline as I cannot figure out how to escape from the continuous newly created space continuum either. Ty could not see the contents inside each metal box but watched each robot work. “Which transplant category will be used on Rann?”
“I will use the autograft transplant technique for one vein extraction that will store all of the non-contaminated warm blood proteins for his new heart organ. However, I need a donor, who is both alive and well, for this easy surgical procedure. The group consensus with my fellow biomedical robots agrees with the overall medical plan using a living subject with renewable tissue and fluids coming from a live body that can provide the life-saving blood transfusion into Prince Rann and all of his new cells for his rejuvenation organ process.”

Bbot-one explained, “Stem cell rejuvenation is a highly successful treatment plus a permanent clinic solution for a medical patient like Prince Rann, who possesses extensive biological damage to his vital heart organ. Stems are a set of primal cells which are found in all multi-cellular organisms that retain the ability to renew life through cell division then growth and finally transformation into a set of specialized cells with characteristics consistent with related tissues, such as, muscles and nerves that occurs through cell culture rather than the traditional harvesting of an organ through an almost dead body with the standard medical procedure.”

The rest of the noble and noblettes are dead and gone as the names and faces invaded my active mind, including Ann, Lady of Bonita; Bartholomew, Baron of Agri; Bea, Countess of Ice; Dee, Marquise of Resort; Dov, Count of Ice; Ito, Priest of Bio; Ivy, Baronetess of Agri, Jo, Governess of Uni; Jon, Governor of Uni, Lad, Viscount of Tech; Las, Priestess of Bio; Rex, King of Commerce; Rosa, Lady of Bonita, Roy, Marquis of Resort; Viv, Princess of Sahara and Zak, Baronet of Agri.

Now, I must add Prince Rann among the newest group of dead people within this new universe, where I continue to thrive without purpose and then return to without reason. I sigh with sorrow.
I wipe the tears of sadness and sorrow wondering about my life form which is trapped here inside a new prisoner room, on a damaged planet, with the last nobles, within the unknown universe. I sigh with defeat.

Stems are a set of primal cells which are found in all multi-cellular organisms that retain the ability to renew life through cell division then growth and finally transformation into a set of specialized cells with characteristics consistent with related tissues, such as, muscles and nerves that occurs through cell culture rather than the traditional harvesting of an organ through an almost dead body with the standard medical procedure.”

A laser bean is a wonderful instrument for a medical surgery, but it leaves a nasty scar on the skin tissue which takes hours, days, and maybe years to heal properly, unless you are friendly with the local Tele Mistress. I sigh with true love.
I can make Rann’s scar heal faster. I touch the burnt scar feeling the raised flesh and misaligned soldering of his tissue, touching the caked blood. Using my telemetabolics, all his bio-life systems are healthy. His breathing method is shallow and steady. His heart rate, pulse, and blood pressure are normal.

I actually have saved his life twice, but who is counting.

Please access then extract that gene using the serotonin transporter, Bbot-two.”
Bbot-two jerks down the lever. The ceiling panel opened and revealed a thick metal arm displaying a sharp needle attached to a small glass tube. The arm carefully drops and hovers at the upper thigh on Rann. The needle slowly punctures the skin and sucks up a white liquid into the glass tube, slowly jerking out from Rann’s skin.

I am Starra Starbuck, measuring five feet and one inch at weighs 95 pounds and one ounce, possessing a head of long, silver tinted, wavy hair, a triangular face, a pair of small gray eye sockets with gray-tinted pupils, a button nose, two apple cheekbones, and a cute cliff chin and a tone of golden tawny colored skin. Alien Day 132

My house is dark and all alone at the end of the city street. Well, that blows my theory of a power problem at the local Bot Control Station. And the non-steering air molecules are sizzling producing a hot and heated night. I sigh with worry.
If I don’t have electricity currents inside my house, then I won’t have cold vented air molecules cooling down my tired, achy, sweaty body. I sigh with frustration.
Tomorrow morning, I am walking naked on my feet to the local Bot Control Station then scream, cry, and complain about with my non-noble but wealthy status as a private citizen. I sigh with disappointment.
I exhale then inhale the air molecules coughing out loud. I smell my stinky body. A cool refreshing flow of cold water over my tired body will relieve my minor problems for the night.
I cross the street and stumble through the garage floor and back into the dark house, carefully strolling up the staircase and enter my private lavatory. I twist the knob handle in the opposite direction without hearing the water floor. I sigh with annoyance.
I am not hearing the rush of fresh water that does not make any sense.
I stand then stumble back into the bedroom pacing around the room while pondering my new dilemma with confusion. I sigh with frustration.
I possess no electricity to see and no water to bath and a smell dirty and stinky body to breathe. I sigh with grim.
I stop and stare down at the lovely bedspread that invites me for sleep.
Forget it!
I plan to bathe all day tomorrow until my body turns pinkie and prunie while figuring out how to access the rest of my curr account, without waiting for six days for a mini-bot. I sigh with riches.
I can use my Tele talents but that is stealing. I have currs. I don’t need to steal merchandise or services, just receive a mini-bot. I drop down to the floor and cuddle on my side. I’m too tired to steal anything but sleep. I sigh with surrender.

I drop back down on the floor and sweat through the heated night, slowly resting instead of sleep. I sigh with annoyance.
