Rann moves beside Ivan and grins down at Starra. “No, Ivan! I would very much like to continue the innocent swordplay with you, but I have a war to run. Thus, the interrogation has concluded.”
Ty points at Starra, “Blindfold her!” A set of two warriors appear in front of Starra. One holds a black tinted cloth in one hand then covers her eyeballs. My last visual image is Rann, who smiles at me. I sigh with intrigue.
I am blindfolded from sight but not bound at my wrist or ankle bones with a set of rough ropes. I slowly stand from the chair and feel the hand on my forearm. The battle warrior does not touch my hand but carefully guides me over the wooden floor, then down a tile hallway towards the starship repair maintenance shop. I smell oil, gasoline fumes, and thick raw liquids that spill from ship engines used for outer space vehicles.
I halt. Then a cupped hand slaps my collar bone slowly bending my two kneecaps, folding my upper body, sliding down into a smooth leather bench seat on a carrier starship, which can hold four persons and six pieces of luggage. I wiggle sideways getting comfortable for the ride into outer space to a new secret location. Rann slides beside Starra on the same bench. I bump into his elbow and smell his fragrance and feel his heat. I sigh with true love.
Pbot flies the carrier ship smoothly gliding off the soil, soaring a short distance in the air waves, then carefully lands the ship with a gently tap. The rear door swishes upright. I feel warm humid air currents bombard my face and body.
Rann wiggles around then slides off the bench then leans inside, grabbing her forearm.
I slide over then stand on top of a hard surface without seeing the new location but smelling new odors, feeling the heated sunlight on my body and my two blinded eye sockets.
He wraps his hand around her elbow tugging Starra ahead moving towards a tall structure.
The ray of heated and bright sunlight disappears from my blinded eyeballs. The air temperature is very cold on my exposed skin tissue. The interior room inside the new mysterious building is very quiet even using my Tele eardrums. Rann stops with Starra then gently removes her blindfold.
I see a tall, long, and wide painted indigo colored auditorium room that could easily hold 200 citizens. I sigh with confusion.
“Would you care for a tour of my city?” He shuffles ahead then stops spinning around, thumbing back over his collar bone, nodding with a smile.
“What city?” I scan an empty room with puzzlement.
Rann motions with a smile. She pads beside him. He cuddles Starra and slowly glides across a hard floor which is not an auditorium but a huge dancing hall, without dancers.
No. This is not a huge dancing hall but a smaller Game stadium without the metal bleachers. On each side wall, a row of booths displays retail shops featuring food items, shoes, clothes, bots, gems, and other pieces of merchandise. A new very loud rock and roll musical song invades the large room then a set of faint human voices, then a set of roaring starship engines, and then a set of squeaking sounds.
I slowly move ahead towards a ground beaten up silver-tinted zipper ship then stop, reaching out, touching the steel, not feeling a sensation of metal. The door is comprised of soft, indigo colored cardboard materials. I sigh with interest.
“Fake.” I announce to every pair of eardrums. I sigh with answer.
“I cannot believe you figured this out. You’re correct and very smart and very other things, Starra,” Rann tromps beside Starra then grabs her hand, swiftly dragging her towards a new object. An air-borne bot is not metal but composed of slick silver-tinted shiny paper.
Now, I understand the large room which represents fakeness including an array of fake starships, fake musical songs, fake merchandise shops, fake food items, fake bots, fake voice, and fake upright life-sized bodies. I reach out and touch a life-sized photograph of a male, who is made of colored paper. “I understand. This is your fake city.” I sigh with brilliance.
“That’s one of my more brilliant military guys, who is named Paper Dan,” he chuckles and pulls Starra into his naked chest. I gladly step into his armpit and sniff his manly cologne of citrus and spices that tickle my nose.
He smiles, “There are no lost lives or bots or equipment or buildings or ships or comlens or comfones, only the fake cardboard materials which become toasted burnt black piles of ashes during each an air attack from nasty Rita,” Rann chuckles with the other nobles in the party.
“A loss for us on paper,” Ivan laughs along with the other nobles standing in a row behind Rann and Starra viewing the enclosed space of fakeness.
I nod with a smile. “I get it. Your fake city is constructed entirely of paper and paper products. The loss is the cost of buying products on paper from real paper.” I sigh with funny.
“Rann is brilliant, since he has constructed from paper a fake military base spreading over five miles on top of a dirt terrain, here on asteroid Resort. You’re visiting only one of ten cities made of parched wood.” Ty states.
Rann and Starra start moving ahead. He points to more fake objects. “There are fake weapons, communication signals, and of course, a tea time presentation for the ladies.” I sigh with true love.
“The formation of this fake military base appears as a working and functioning entity complete with recorded voices, mechanical sounds, and human figures. This is very clever, Rann.” I halt with a gasp.
My Tele senses ping. Everything ain’t fine, darling!

“I can feel ...”

He gasps in shock then slowly follows Starra, nodding with a smile. “Yes, you are correct again, Starra. I must say that I’m very impressed with your Tele abilities.”

On the 11th hour of an early afternoon, the carrier ship flies over the ocean waters in the pale blue sky with parted cloud and 88ºF of sizzling, humid air waves landing on top of a sea yacht.

The floor and sides are made of metal and painted indigo. “O! This is a boat.” I survey the boat and my new watery environment. I sigh with apprehension.
Back home on Planet Earth within the Milky Way Galaxy, I reside on a farm of hilly land, shade trees, plant bushes, wildflowers, domestic and wild animals, farm equipment, field crops, and good friends. The land mass is located on four corners within my farm biosphere. Well, the sphere is a semi-round geometric shape, not square shaped object. I view bodies of water, such like, small ponds, lakes, and tiny creek streams. He smiles, “This is a sea yacht.” Rann and I stroll elegantly towards the curvy metal railing on the sea yacht that sails over salt water.

Alien Day 138


Sea yacht location
Starra’s private state room

6th hour (early morning)
Sizzling air temperatures, bright sunlight and slight ocean wind


My new holding cell is located on the second deck with the rest of the state rooms. I’m on a floating metal machine with limited space and surrounded by miles of water and numerous royal nobles that I have not seen for a day and a night for some reason. I do not have a side or forward wall with a glass window, but I use some of my Tele talents to talk and sense all the aquatic mammals that live and swim and roam in vast Resort Ocean.
The aquatic mammals and fishes are happy that the nasty citizens have abandoned their home. They are safe and happy producing new aquatic families living the wildlife within natural seas. I sigh with nature.
O yeah! The reason I cannot leave my state room is the first solar system is participating in another Galactic Civil War with the second solar system. I sigh with repeat.
Inside my prisoner state room, it displays a twin bed, a private lavatory, and a single window that shows the brightest eastern sun. A small closet holds no clothes. I sigh with luxury.
I rub the flakey sleepy crusts from each eye socket then smear the yellow dried stuff on the used bed linens surveying the dark wooden panels then I see a bot. I yell for meanness. “What!”

“Do it later!” I sneer like an alien princess then yawn with an ugly open mouth of princess rudeness.

The robot has forgotten to add, where the other nobles lounge underneath a shaded veranda in the sunlight sucking down a cold coffee within the light breeze and do not trust me. I sigh with disappointment.
I am the party responsible for the “Lost in Space” adventure involving Rann and it is coupled with destroying the comfone communication link during my secret visitation. So, the nobles might be a little bit upset with my person, but Rann is not upset. As a matter of fact, he is very pleased with me. I sigh with true love.
I wear the same wrinkled sundress and exit my cabin, landing on the top deck, where the sun is hot. The wind is cool. The air is salty. And no noble stands here to greet my face or hang my neck muscles. I sigh with happiness.
I stroll ahead towards the protective steel railing that keeps a person from dropping down into the ocean water and whispers for my eardrums only, “Water, water everywhere, and not a drop to drink.” The fairy tale invades my sleepy mind, again, this morning. I feel thirsty and stop, pouring a cold beverage into an empty tumbler at the provided table of fresh food and cold beverages. And I am being watched; I can feel it. I sigh with insecurity.
I walk to the end of the food table and slid down into the coral tinted lounge chair facing the placid ocean waters. I’m not being watched; I do not feel it. I sigh with embarrassment.

On the 9th hour, of late morning, among the pale blue sky and bright sunlight without clouds and with the air temperatures of 90 degrees Fahrenheit, I continue to sit inside the flying zipper ship, wearing a blindfold over both of my two eyeballs. I can feel the bright sunlight on my exposed and unexposed body parts, reaching up, ripping off the blindfold and gasp in shock. The surface is rough and soft, at the same time, as my spiked heeled summer sandals sink down into the ground. The island is composed of gleaming and blinding yellow-tinted sand grains, an unspoiled secluded sandy beach lies along a semi-circular seashore line. I study the lagoon, miles of both sand grains and ocean waters, and two machine bots a few feet ahead of us.
No one lives or visits here, today, either. I sigh with fright.

The sea life feed and dance around numerous pinkish-orange tinted coral reefs a few miles from the beach island for fun, since the island mass is both people-less and city-less. The island mass comprises 1,000 feet wide by 1,000 feet long and a slight land elevation of ten inches from the rippling ocean waves.
“O! Is this my new prisoner cell?” I turn and wink to Rann exhibiting my dark humor and total shock of personal isolation with my man. I sigh with true love.
He leans into her smile. “Well, I am protecting you from Rita and her spies.” I sigh with frustration.
I huff with annoyance, “How gallant of you!” I can care for my person as I have demonstrated in the past six alien timelines and the current seventh alien timeline. And I don’t believe for an instant his fluffy fairy tale. Anyways, Rann is the one and only citizen that Rita wants to contain or kill, not my life form.
I pull off my sandals first slowly strolling ahead, sinking my toe bones down in the shallow warm water and yellow tinted, soft sand grains. Waves of salt ocean waters rush and then wash off the sand over my ankle bones down to my pink-painted toes making me giggle from the funny sensation. I sigh with delight.
He continues to hold her hand and leads Starra ahead while they follow the can on two shiny robots. He smiles. “I want you to be careful and concerned as we are surrounded by creatures of the sea consisting of hunger sharks, large whales, school of fish and a fleet of perinea.”
I laugh and shake my wet curls. “I might be a land lover, but I do know that a school of vicious biting perinea fish do not live in salt water, Rann. Are you testing me?”
“I only tell you this information for your good, so do not try to escape from the island…
“…or you,” I smile. “And where in the world would I escape too? I see miles of sands without buildings and miles of water with dangerous marine life and miles of blue sky without a single starship and miles of bright sunlight for a heat stroke.” I softly giggle at his silly statement. I sigh with fun.
In the short distance, the land mass is dotted with a row of three small structures. He points ahead at the next object. “Up ahead, another hot spot, that can indeed give you a heat stroke, is called Noble Island.”

He nods with a smile and continues to wave his hand in the air, “That’s geology. This is a geological explanation for the varying water temperatures on each island. Surrounding Sun Island, there is a thick band of sand barges that goes way down into the ocean floor. The sand barges are walkable during low tide, but you can swim out there during high tides and still walk on top of the sand barges along with the flying fish. The other sea mammals do not come near the sand barges without getting stranded or harmed. So, we enjoyed our day playing around the sand barges and the water was warm. Within the large circle of sand barges, six miles down, the ocean floor is comprised of volcanos that are not active but spit out plumes of heated steam. The heated steam slowly raises through the water and heats the water molecules. Thus, the water temperature is heated at Sun Island.
“That same circle of sand barges that goes way down to the ocean floor also cuts off all the white-tinted plumes of heated steam from Noble Island. So, the water temperature is always cold-feeling. Then, the dead air pressure becomes composed of dense thick and heavy carbon emissions. The thick heavy carbon emissions are being pulled down naturally by Resort’s gravity right over us.”
“Aw! You’re trying to make me laugh. That’s so sweet, Rann. But I think I’d rather you just rescue me from Rita.” I sneer and then panic for both of us.
“The maser stream weighs more than the air below it, so both the air molecules and stinky stream are sinking over the rooftop on the zipper ship and then down in the water.” He lectures and can barely press a series of buttons on the console.
I feel really funny and then whisper. “Go faster, Rann!” I view miles of rough seas, where Rita’s new electronic toy causes some strange new weather patterns.
He wiggles his finger pads and body parts in his chair, “The air pressure dome is over 100 miles long and 60 miles high going down into the water surface. I can’t jump an invisible field of energy. Ugh! My fingers are getting numb also. I can hardy press a single button.”
I extend my arms and shake my curls, “I feel the heavy air molecules around my body like I’m becoming crushed like a nut in a nutcracker, Rann.” Then I wrap my arms around my chest blocking out the heavier air currents while breathing in shallow puffs of stale air.
“No! You are not becoming crashed with an object. The air pressure is settling over your limb muscles and your nerve endings within your human body.”
I sob with tears and worry feeling the zipper fall down towards the water. “I’m cold, Rann.”
“I can’t…uh…I can’t move my fingers. They’re glued to the steering column. Our air molecules are swiftly becoming chilled like a freezer for fresh animal meat.”
I bare whisper and wiggle but cannot unstick from the leather seat, “I’m stuck inside my seat. I can’t move my legs. I feel like an ice cube. My skin is turning blue.”
“We are frozen, literally, inside our seats in the zipper along with all the mechanic controls.” He yells in panic and views the rush of ocean waves. “Prepare for an emergency landing!”
“I am!”
A blue colorful beam hits our zipper penetrating the force field shielding creating a loud thump sound. Rita catches our zipper with a tractor beam before we fall and break into a zillion pieces in the ocean. I sigh with doom.
I can’t move. I link, connect, and Tele-talk into his open mind.
I can’t move, either. Rann links, connects, and Tele-talks back to Starra without understanding his innate Tele table.
Then I pass out into darkness.

Alien Day 143


Space Station Uni
Cold dark outer space minus 1000ºF
8th hour (early morning)

“Your long skirt will be slit and made of iridescent stones showing off your legs.” He winks. “An iridescent stone is a semi-precious gem that glitter in the bright sunlight rays similar to a diamond with touches of yellow, orange, pink, red, green, and blue embedded into the silver fabric.”

He leans over and types on the keyboard with five fingers, “Well, you are almost ready. I would suggest leaving from Uni and attending your dress fitting.”
“What about my Empress floatie?” I smile and bat my eyelashes.
He sits back with a frown then softly chuckles, “Well, I’ll be very happy to supervise the design, decoration, and décor of the floatie there on Agri while you are getting fitted for your dress. All building supplies and clothing fabrics are made and housed on Agri. We can leave Uni and travel to Agri in my zipper ship. Then we can go and dine with Ty and Joy for our evening meal. How does that sound, Starra?”
“Lovely!” I smile.
Rann snaps his fingers and stands from the chair leaning down, assisting Starra to stand.
I wobble in the pair of high heeled sandals and wadded tail ends on the long skirt appearing like a matron, not a maiden. Dirk had gifted my room with more purple colored boxes that contained the ugliest clothes in the galaxy.

“Yes, Sire,” The lead guard nods and stands in place.
Rann extends his arm. I accept his arm. We spin around and slowly exit the library setting for his zipper ship and the trip to Planet Agri.

The first competitor to reach 500 points wins the right to marry Emperor Dirk.” The audience does not cheer but mumbles to each other. I sigh with brilliance.
Wow! That ancient, smelly Book has an answer for everything. I gasp in alarm. That book can get me home going through the wormhole safely. I wring my hands and calculate how to retrieve the Book. Rann has a copy of a red Book on his home world. I sigh with hope.
“The citizens of the universe have selected Empress-in-Waiting candidate Viscountess Rita from the planet of Tech.”
Dirk claps and spins around thrusting an arm to Rita. Told ya’ll! I’m always right, well, sometimes, I miss. I missed the tie thing.
The audience cheers too wildly, and that silly clown blasts out a series of loud honks then the setting turns silence.
I continue to sit and stare at Rann whispering for my eardrums only. “I am not going to marry Dirk. I am going to marry Rann.” I sigh with true love.
The Master of Ceremonies watches Dirk. Dirk lifts his arm above his crown and then presents a thumbs up signal on his hand.
My Tele senses ping. Everything ain’t right, darling!
“Countess Starra of the planet of Ice.”

This is not good, ya’ll. Dirk has planned something, and it is going to happen to me. I sigh with dread.

Alien Day 146

Dirk’s castle
Bedroom suite setting

Cooking is the first royal match. I’m required to cook food. I don’t know how to cook food. I never cooked a single recipe of food in my life. Since living here, a bot does the food collecting, the food preparation, the food cooking, the food disposing, and the food stealing for me. Or I’d starve, which I have done before.

Alien Day 147

Show no mercy!” She snarls then sneers then screeches and finally hisses stopping in place, staring at Starra. The mob of blood thirsty citizens wildly react with a series of crazy animal noises then hoots plus applaud, boot stamps, bell whistles and the loud honking sounds coming from that silly clown. I sign with fear.
I can’t see Dirk, but his smile burns into my back spine. I sigh with disgust.

I drop down from the stool and mentally gather my isolated and calm mental thoughts feeling a little nervous and a lot overconfident. My hands sweat and my brain numbs. My heart pounds and legs shake. I have an answer to this question. I clear my tight throat. “I would like to see, with all my generous heart, along with a kind compassionate soul peace. Peace with the pirates!” The mod of blood thirsty citizens sound with a series of boos, hisses, mouth spittle on the floor and each other, and yell out a steam of unkind nasty vile words. I sigh with danger.

I mentally flash backwards, into the third alien timeline, when I negotiated peace with the pirates on asteroid Resort.

I mentally flash back present within the same timeline hearing the stream of unkind nasty vile words coming from the wild and crazy audience members. But I stand and take it. I am a kind person feeling both hurt and defeated. I swing my face and view Rann in his skybox. He stands and wears a stern face while outlining a maser with his finger pads, watching the angry crowd. I feel better. Rann is going to protect my person. I sigh with safety.
Dirk swiftly stands and shockingly shouts using his Tele voice at the audience members, “Silence!” The citizens stop the racket. He smirks as his ugly face shows on a row of mounted comlens on each upper wall space, “I applaud Countess Starra for her honest heartfelt diplomatic answer. She has truly expressed a most compassionate response to a very difficult problem.” He pauses then nods with a wicked grin. “However, I plan to implement Viscountess Rita’s idea immediately. I award Rita the 100 points for this royal match.” The mob of blood thirsty citizens react again standing with some natives fighting each other for fun while sounding with a series of loud cheers, hand claps, boot stomps, bell whistles without exiting the building for their home.
Dirk or Rita join the action and do not exit the building either.
I silently leave the building surrounded by my honor guard unit. I sigh with doom.

Alien Day 149


Fourth Royal Match

Militia Space Station location
Hanger deck setting
Cold dark outer space with minus 1000ºF

8th hour (early morning)


Each empress candidate is required to fly a zipper ship through an outer space obstacle course in a death race.
Just kidding! Been there, done that!

I mentally flash backwards, into the first alien timeline, when I raced Prince Rann to the Wall and back to his noble castle in a death race.

I stand on top of the flat concrete surface a few feet from my assigned zipper ship, wearing a new outfit, from Rann, of course, a gray tinted, long-sleeveless, turtleneck blouse, a straight short matching skirt, and my thigh-high boots with my new dagger while looking cute. I sigh with beauty.

Emperor Dirk is a brave man and his future empress should exhibit the same qualities consisting of courage, spunk, and boldness.”
I painfully bit the lower lip on my mouth while laughing out loud with the humorous statement. Nbots monitor every cute muscle on a face. I sigh with silence.
“The obstacle course starts here at the Militia space station located on the other side of the Wall inside the second solar sun system. If this is not enough stress for a future Empress, the last obstacle course is to drive the zipper back through the Wall for a second run, encircling asteroid Resort for a second air-drop. Then the Empress pilot returns to the Militia space station with an empty cargo bag completing the obstacle course and finishing the fourth royal match. If you have not broken your special package of champagne, then you can celebrate with your family and friends tonight with your victory win of the obstacle course. And, finally, the Empress pilot will collect three hundred points,” he smiles with Dirk.
I return and smile through the glittering force field inside the docking space that keeps in breathable air and out the suffocating outer space waves of poison that kills a living life form. This isn’t the most difficult of the empress tests, but the Wall isn’t like baking a pie. If you don’t get through the natural barrier swiftly, it will eat you for its lunch meal. Rita knows all too well. She has lived in the universe her whole entire life. Her husband Viscount Lad died racing Prince Rann to the Wall, during one of Rann’s post-game victory dinner parties. I read that datum inside my mini-bot.

I swing around and preform a sexy priss towards the ladder on the ship. I don’t wanna hear, see, taste or feel a shocking surprise. Traveling at 900 miles-per-hour inside a starship, a pilot cannot perform a change safety adjustment before encountering an accidental mechanical problem or a sabotaged failed engine inside an enclosed oxygen-need-to-breathe one-person cockpit. This is the still the strangest type of physics that I’ve ever seen in actual theory.

Alien Day 150


Fifth Royal Match

Red tinted unknown building
Auditorium setting

6th hour (sunset hour, early evening)
Warm temperatures and red, yellow, blue sunset


I sit on top of a smooth long bench behind a red tinted, naked wooden picnic table with Rita sitting…naw…snarling…naw…drooling a few feet across from me. I’m absolutely clueless about the fifth royal match. Maybe, we are going to play a nice game of checkers.
I like to play checkers, cards, chess, and other board games. The games stimulate both my intellect and psyche into higher intelligence and competition. Then I’ll win this match for shore. I sigh with dreaming.

I mentally flash backwards, onto Planet Earth, when I played with Ming’s grandchildren and great-grandchildren on my home of Starbuck Plantation, each Sunday afternoon, after the church services and a big lunch meal.

I mentally flash back present, within the current alien timeline, I am too busy saving my precious fanny from Dirk, instead of marrying Rann. Two evil, vile villains figuratively and literally are fighting with me, but I possess a secret ally.
I flip my eyelashes and see Rann, who is a handsome, rich, brilliant, and courageous noble. And he secretly poses as both my protector and bodyguard while giving me advice, gifts, and weapons for both my security and safety. I sigh with true love.

I’m look elegant in a beautiful silver-diamond stubbed gown with two puffy sleeves surrounded by a mid-drift garment exposing my rib cage and suntanned skin tissue coupled with a long, shimmering diamond-encrusted sweep skirt with a three feet long dress train. I look hot, elegant, and like an empress while waving with smiles at the gathering crowd of citizens, who will witness the next round of cat fighting with Rita.

Rann provided a gift also, a beautiful pair of elegant high-heeled matching sandals. Yeah, I wear them, but I like my new gown. The old gray one smells stinks from salt, perfume, and perspiration. I sigh with loveliness.
I stare at Rann inside his noble skybox, since I can’t wave. He sees me and doesn’t wave either, but our dancing eyes met. Our loving hearts touch and our minds join sharing a single same mental thought: I truly love you.
The Master of Ceremonies appears the same and stands in the same wall corner over a mounted comlen saying into the comfone, “Welcome, citizens to the fifth royal match within the Empress-in-Waiting competition. You have seen our ruler fight with vigor, honor, and duty against the evil and vile pirates that once roamed and sacked our universe. His empress must display the same bold traits to ruler beside our great leader. She must possess strength, might, and concentration.”
She must possess bold traits fighting with vigor and honor against Dirk. I do believe the historian needs to update the Commerce history books. I sigh with duty.
“The two Empress-in-Waiting candidates will engage in an arm-to-arm wrestling match.”
The citizens go wild yelling, hooting, hand clapping, boot stamping, and bell whistling.

Then Dirk and his pilot is embraced within an invisible force field.
I can see tiny sparks of pinkish-silver sparks that form within the protection physical force field looking all cute and pretty. Dirk sees it too but feels stunned puzzlement within his thick brain cells. Then Dirk and his pilot chair swiftly lower down from the cockpit floor, without a scream, quickly dropping through an opening within the belly section on the carrier ship, sucking him into the outer space waves directly in front of the wormhole. The floor belly slams shut, compliments of a dead Rita.
I live inside the warm carrier ship. Dirks lives protectively surrounded by a metal armor around a pilot’s ejection seat. I am going to tattle on Dirk to Rann. Then Rann will kick Dirk’s butt-hole off Commerce and right back onto Bonita. I will survive and then marry Rann while we live happily ever after within the eighth alien timeline. I sigh with true love.
Pretty long and short plumes in yellow, red, and blue hue swiftly expanse from the ring of fire and then quietly dissipates into a beautiful forming nothingness of invisible shape within outers space waves in front of the carrier ship. His pilot chair has a set of independent controls that glide his ship safely down to Planet Bonita. I sigh with safe.
My Tele senses ping. Everything ain’t fine, darling!
I moan. “Of course, it’s not fine for Dirk!” I laugh. “I just need to reach out and touch…” My ship is hit with a red tinted maser wave. My body flings sideways then backwards. I gasp in alarm. “What the…?” I continue to wobble out of control within the sticky leather stripes, not being able to shift my pinky finger with steady control. I sigh with seasickness.
A second maser ray hits the side metal. The ship tilts to the left side. I lean in the same direction and catch a third glowing streak of a red tinted maser wave missing the ship as an unknown assailant assaults my ship. I sigh with trouble.
I gasp in alarm and sit sideways. “No! No! No!” I sigh with doom.
My man Rann has arrived here and flies his modified zipper ship in front of the wormhole thinking the ship is piloted by Dirk.

I will eject from the carrier cockpit and fly directly into the mouth of the fiery wormhole without protection and then die. My bad! Dirk didn’t have time to explain the instructions for activating the body armor around my chair and my person to safely ride through the wormhole. I sigh with annoyance.

The ship is twirling sideways out of control in a free fall as I am trapped inside a nicely cinnamon-smelling passenger chair.
I am too tired from fighting with Rita and too dizzy inside a twirling, burning carrier ship. The ship swiftly soars ahead towards the gravitation pull of the wormhole then slams into the edge of ring of fire. All the glass windows crack and the flight wings start dropping off the metal. Hot metal moans and sizzling gears sing in a musical tone within my eardrums. My ship descends into a soaring speed of deceleration. Frying heat waves bombard my freckles and as my body is still trapping inside a disintegrating burning coffin with layers of 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit searing plumes of hotness. The heat melts all the metal on the buttons, the dials, and the gadgets cracking my Tele shield.
I feel hot, sweaty, deaf, and blind. I can’t see, hear or breathe. Then I pass out into darkness.

I sit, numbingly, in my assigned seat, and blind, purposefully, with my two gray-tinted eyelashes shut. I do not move or think or pray but I am alive and thankful for my survival of a crashing Earth space shuttle ship.
I un-belt the seat restraints then open my eyelashes, popping off the space suit helmet. I leap from the seat with a smile and spin around gasping in shock. I see half of a pilot’s chair. But I’m fully intact along with my long hair roots. I twirl around and lean my freckles down into the functional console instrument panel studying a rough landscape terrain on the new planet.
I see mountains on the left side and a series of healthy tall shade trees in lovely green leaves, low-lying rows of green plant and fruit bushes, and healthy grass and flower foliage on my right side. A dry crooked narrow vehicle path lies in the middle of the two natural landscapes.
My Tele senses ping. Everything is fine.
I back step with a smile from the console panel then spin around leaping off the broken cockpit platform, flying in the air, landing on a plot of thick green tinted grass blades, in silence. I face a hidden object in the far distance and whisper into my eardrums, “A structure that’s thirteen miles northeast of my standing position.”
I feel the burning rays of sunshine and look up and then lovingly scan the blinking rays of a yellow sun, a pretty pale blue sky without colorful or white clouds. I have traveled both space and time to here before making it nine times.

Tok is the only child from his dead father Marquis Roy and his dead mother Marquise Dee inheriting a damaged Resort but lives on Space Station Uni with all the schooled children and teenagers in an academic environment. He sits between two empty chairs with Ty on his far right-side and Dirk too far away on his left-side. Tok folds his tall six feet plus body frame and 300 plus pounds of taunt and tight muscles inside a larger chair, wearing a traditional royal attire in indigo hue consisting of a short tunic jacket, a pair of trousers, a long cloak, like his dead father.
He wears a head of shoulder length brown hair strands, a dusted face of brown and blonde tinted whiskers, a tone of peach colored skin, and a pair of aqua eyeballs.
Alas! I am the one of six nobles and the only noblette attending the boring weekly noble meeting. The two married noblettes are invited but do not attend the noble meeting due to Dirk’s terrible attitude and nasty royal behavior.
Once I am married to my man Rann, I will stay home and watch the comlen and gossip on the comfone too. Just kidding!
Let me tell you a secret! No citizen likes Dirk, only Dirk!
Tok looks up with a stern face from his mini-bot screen nodding his head, speaking in a deep baritone timber, “I understand your point of view, Dirk. For the past four sporting competitive game sessions, the Golden Sahara Warriors team has not only won but flattened all the player competition. As we head into the Game championship days, the same Golden Sahara Warriors team does not have another group of worthy opponents to challenge their existing Game reign. Thus, each game competition is boring. I receive both vocal and electronic comments all the time from my home world citizens, who didn’t want to attend the Game dinner and dance event anymore but rather visit all the markets purchasing goods and then head back home to sleep.” I gasp in shock at the insult to Rann then turn studying Tok. 
“Exactly my point! Very good comment, Tok!” Dirk nods without shifting the purple-encrusted gemstone skull crown. The other nobles and noblettes softly mumble, not Rann.
“I propose the Game players get paid for both their talents and skills rather than volunteering for fun. I suggest a professionalized sporting agency from each paying noble currs.” He smiles at Rann.
Tok turns and smiles at Dirk. “I like that new business idea, too, Dirk.” He lives in the real world. His two space stations are home for all types of characters in the universe.
I enjoy the competitive Game sporting event, when a talented team plays against another talent team that makes the action exhilarating to watch. You feel the action. You hear the grunts of the active players. You see sprays of the flying flesh pieces and bone fragments. You smell the spilling blood proteins and spurting bile liquid in the air. All of this is an addiction, if you love violence. And finally, you taste the delicious victory and eat the defeat depending on your team home planet.
The Sahara Golden Warriors game team from Planet Sahara wins all the time, since their players have the talent, skill, and guts. The players are highly trained coming from the prison duty roster approved by Prince Rann making them invincible in battle, on a football game field. Sometimes, too invincible! The game becomes really boring watching when the Golden Warriors lead by fifty points the first hour of the competitive sporting event.
I nod with a smile to Dirk, “I like your idea too, Dirk. The players are proud to serve their noble, where they live and thrive. But the planet is not necessarily their home world but play the sport, the action, and the Game. The game is the kill the players anticipate, await, and attain.” Then I feel a sharp ache on my non-booted leg. Rann had viciously slapped my shin using his leather boot. I do not react with my string of nasty words that’s floating around my neurons. I continued to stare at Dirk and simply reach down and rub my finger pads on a quickly forming blue tinted bruise using a Tele heal touch with my telemetabolics easing the pain, stopping the wound.
“Thank you for your encouraging and brave and bold comment, Countess.” Dirk turns and smiles to Starra.
“You are most welcome, Your Highness,” I nod. Someone appreciates my person, my view of point, and my opinion. I sigh with delight.
“Done! The new Game sporting competitive tryouts will commence immediately for one work week, five standard days. Is there any more business ideas or suggestions?” Dirk smiles. No one grunts. He claps then stands. “The weekly noble meeting is dismissed.”
Rann swiftly stands upright then leans down pulling out Starra’s chair from the table, offering his hand as he is one of two gentlemen in the room. I stand then wobble in my fluffy dress scooting away from the chair, facing Rann.
“I don’t realize you enjoyed watching the ball games, Starra.” Ty appears and stands beside Rann smiling at Starra.
I nod in silence to Ty. Really, no person stands inside my Ice noble skybox with me. I need to get out more and socialize with the other commoners, instead of saving my fanny from an evil Dirk or saving Rann’s fanny from the same evil Dirk. I sigh with evil.
Rann cuddles Starra and slowly shuffles them from the meeting room, pacing down an empty hallway. General Ivan stays behind inside the meeting room talking with Dirk, like always, keeping the universe safe and the king alive. I sigh with death.
I walk between Rann and Ty looking down at the long ugly hallway, smiling with my words, “The game is bestest when the two teams are tearing each other apart, tossing their opponent’s blood and guts...” I feel a sharp index finger nail tickling the fourth rib bone coming from Rann’s free hand. 
Rann stares at her nose profile, “Violence begets violence.”
I gasp in shock pondering my mental thoughts. Who died and made Rann the universe’s philosopher? I turn and wink at Dirk, “It’s just a game, darling!”
“An event, I might add that teaches youngsters to solve problems using both physical aggression and mental brutality.” He states.
“So does those rows and rows of Dirk’s royal edicts, but you don’t see me lecturing him,” I strike back with force wearing a smirk of victory. Ty snickers along with Tok, not Rann.
And I happen to know that Rann silently roots for his old team, the Sahara Golden Warriors within his heart, mind, and body. He continues to personally hire and train the Game players in cheek-to-fist fighting and heavy degrees of physical aggression and brutality, pretending as a boring, snoring Sahara prince of the hot, sizzling deserts.
“What kill? The players anticipate, await, and attain the ultimate goal, the competition.” He smiles.
“Really! Well, maybe, I’ll form my own Game sporting team with the ultimate goal of competition too, to boot.” I giggle. I’m well received as the newest and only noblette within the ancient noble circle this timeline, not wanting to either challenge or fight with them again.
He turns and nods to the hallway, “Your attempt would become most difficult and slightly redundant, since you are going to become Princess Starra of Agri. And you will rightly own fifty percent of the Agri Green Farmers sporting team.”
“Really! The Agri Greenie Non-meanie Farmers don’t play very well, do they?” I frown. Ty snickers with the truth.
Tok slowly paces behind the front row nobles including Rann, Starra, and Ty then viciously slaps the collar bone on Starra with one of his large burly hands. I slightly tumble forward away from Rann’s arm then execute a Tele halt using my telekinesis jerking back into Rann’s body from Tok’s innate brute strength. He should be playing in the Game. Then his sporting team would win the Championship Game each season.
“Way to go, Starra! If Rann doesn’t want you watching the Game, then I invite you to come and join me in my skybox. I’ll have a special seat waiting for you.” Tok laughs with amusement. I sigh with pride.
I’m on a hot streak today. Another person has listened to my comments. I swing my head and smile at Tok then spin back around slowly pacing with Rann.
Rann fumes with jealousy. He cares about his future bride princess. I sigh with pleasure.
Before I compliment Tok, Rann responds and stares down the long hallway, “Starra isn’t my pawn. She can come and go as she pleases.”
Tok nods, “That’s good news for my eardrums!” He scoots around Ty and gently slams the bicep on Ty without harming the shorter male then spins around standing front of the row of other royals. “My offer still stands, Starra! And I’ll see everyone tomorrow at the Jubilation activities.” He taps his two booted heels for respect and then bows down at his fitted waistline to royal noblette standing upright and grins to each noble.
I slightly nod my curls while graciously remarking, “Thank you, Tok! I’m touched by your precious offer.” I continue to practice becoming a polished diplomat, not accepting or rejecting Tok’s idea. I do want Tok as my alley. And I don’t want Rann as my enemy. I respect Rann. But we’re going to become married as a royal couple. He has to respect my rational and irrational ways being a hidden alien. I sigh with alien.
Tok spins around and leads the rest of the nobles out the building towards the row of starships for a journey back to their castle on Planet Commerce.

Alien Day 154


Planet Commerce
Auditorium setting

Jubilation Day

Sunny with parted clouds at 67ºF
11th hour (early afternoon)


The day is cool, calm and boring as usual and the universe is at peace for once. Having Dirk as the current king is not my first choice of rulers, but there he sits in a padded golden tinted throne chair on top of the center wooden platform in purple paint within the ninth alien timeline. The best news of all, Dirk hasn’t threatened to mangle, maim, or murder my body. I sigh with lucky.
Dirk finishes reading the last name from the last list. A shiny, rounded-shaped gong instrument stands on top of the stage platform then lovely chimes in a musical note from a slave…naw…servant from Dirk’s palace I sigh with confusion.
I frown and ponder the gong musical instrument which is a new item within the alien time line. However, the musical tone is smoothing. The timeline is quietus harmony. There are not surprise body attacks or starship wars or violent acts. I sigh with peace.
Well, that isn’t exactly correct, since I’m seeing plenty of physical action, the fast and furious love relationship kind. I’m not complaining. Rann has not wasted any time from our brief life-saving introduction on Planet Bonita to developing our sweetly dating ritual on Planet Commerce leading into something much more. I’m not just hearing wedding bells, since the church bells are being brushed and polished for our upcoming wedding next month. I sigh with marriage.
I’m going married to Rann next month as he works out the entire wedding details. He enjoys bossing people around the universe. My only responsibility is to show up on our wedding day in my wedding dress. I don’t have to worry about missing that scheduled wedding event, due to any unforeseen circumstances, such like, thieves, burglars, kidnappers, assassins, mercenaries, and atypical bad guy or gal types, who wants to harm my petite-ness. I sigh with protection.
As soon as Rann placed an eight-carat diamond ring on my fourth finger of my left hand, I was assigned a battalion of honor guards for my personal security, safety, and protection, 20 hours per day, and five days a week. (That’s a Commerce day light saving time frame.) Actually, it’s a big pain in my noblette fanny as I am guarded all the time, but hey, it saves on healing my body over and over again. I sigh with healthy.
Rann has been through this before with Starra within the other previous alien timelines, of course, he doesn’t directly remember the event within his clicking neurons. But his set of Tele powers are very intuitive about Starra. I sigh with true love.
Our wedding day is planned as gigantic grandiose with one parade including commoner and noble floats, banners, flowers, food, cakes, horses, dancers, entertainers, and breath in air molecules. There are the numerous dance and dinner parties throughout the castles on Planet Commerce all provided and paid by Prince Rann. He can afford all the items as he is a gazillionaire. I’m Starra with an assigned countess title to a radiated planet with no citizens, no currs, and no problems. I sigh with simplicity.
Inside my Ice royal skybox, during the Jubilation Day activities, I back step from the open window then swing around viewing each side wall that holds a long nicely decorated table in pink cloth with numerous food trays, consisting of meats, fruits, desserts, beverages, and finger foods. Man, I can’t eat all this food provided by my prince coming from Food World. Food World or Planet Agri feeds all the hungry mouths and empty tummies of citizens. But my fiancé prince delights in overindulging all his personal friends plus his pampered, spoiled fiancé princess. I, of course, possess three times the amount of food items resting here inside my royal skybox as I am the only occupant inside my square-shaped box. I sigh with suckiness.
Rann, not I, decided that he or I could not share a royal skybox during the standard royal activities including the sporting Game event. My marriage plans have not been publicly announced to the citizens or some of the highly suspicious nobles. Rann is concerned about retaliation or revenge from King Dirk on his fiancé princess Starra, when the good news is announced. Thus, Rann and I are acting like an arrogant individual royal noble and staying in our royal house until the day of our marriage ceremony. I sigh with interference.
Back inside the skybox, the four walls are painted in white hue without a single piece of art work or a spying two-way glass mirror on my noble neighbor either. Count Dov and his wife removed the furniture and items from their noble skybox before the start of the Galactic Civil War in the first alien timeline.
Rann provided a long sofa in solid pink hue that holds a foot stool on each end between two side tables. Each wall holds the refreshment table. The entrance wall only displays an elegantly curved entrance/exit archway that can become locked and bolted, in case of attack from Dirk, but my Tele powers can do that job better. I sigh with protection.
In the wall corner, a guard robot sits on the floor looking shiny, acting quiet until I order the command to attack and then kill. Just kidding!
Note: A robot here within the unknown universe does not kill, only a cold, black-hearted, robotic Dirk.
The forward wall displays a long, wide open hole without a glass pane. The noble and his noble friends and family members can stand or lean over the wide and secure flat wooden ledge enjoying the current activities on the floor or on the top of the stage platform.
Outside my noble skybox, numerous small tables and chairs newly stand filled with numerous honor guards coming from the palaces of Agri, Sahara and Ice. They nosily chat and eat the food platters while pretending to guard the nobles.
Rann is such a caring noble. He ordered the construction of a new slender hallway with a wide, long open hole in-between the Ice royal skybox space and his Agri skybox area, where a pod of comfortable green tinted chairs and sofas rest on top of the floor, holding some of the guards, who do not care to hear or see Dirk.
Back inside the skybox, I ignore Dirk’s words too then moan with unhappiness, “What a waste?” I’m not actually sitting or standing alone and lonely. My devoted and re-programmed tall, slender, cylinder-shaped, sliver-tinted Gbot keeps me company 20 hours per day and night. But numerous individuals need to eat all this food, before it becomes ruined. I do not like wasting any new or old items. I sigh with recycle.
I flip my hand and order to Gbot, “Offer all the food trays to my lovely honor guards.” I love giving out my princessly royal orders feeling like the queen of the universe. I sigh with power.
The eye sensors on the Gbot glow in bright red hue and as the loud voice box drones in a baritone timber. “Your royal honor guard unit from the planet of Ice has availed themselves four times to the food trays. I have documented and recorded each stealing session on my comlen for your review and reprimand later, Princess Starra.” I sigh with tattle-tail.
I softly giggle at the robot and my honor guards. Each male and female guard displays a bulky body frame. Rann doesn’t scrimp on my personal protection. Each female guard stands twice my petite height and twice my light weight. No citizen or bot in the unknown universe is going to take, tease, or talk to me when my personal little army guards my body. Sweet and kind Rann thinks about my welfare all the time. I sigh with true love.
Ty whispered to Starra that Rann had personally interviewed and then tested each guard candidate selecting the ones with the bestest brains, brawn, and bravery from Planet Sahara. The best bodyguards train, live, and work there also.
Now, I have them.
Ty isn’t worried about the security environment on the Prison Planet, since the bestest and brightest guards will return back to him, after Rann’s wedding day. This security arrangement is only temporary for Starra. Ty is another gentleman within the unknown universe. I sigh with honor.
I spin around and scan the auditorium floor seeing all the natives then princessly order, “Bot, take all the food trays down to the natives on the auditorium floor. I want you to distribute the food trays starting on the last row of citizens.” Gbot doesn’t talk or move. I spin around and sneer at the robot, “I gave you an order, Trash can!”
“Countess Starra, I cannot follow that order,” the bot drones.
“Why not?” I spin back around and survey the citizens. Lots of the natives are eating, drinking, and making a big mess in the bleacher seats and on the floor tiles. I sigh with confusion.
“If a hungry or thirsty citizen wants a plate of food or a cold beverage, then a citizen can purchase the food items from a crowded line of food vendors on the entrance wall within the auditorium proper which provides a varied selection of nutriment…”
“… for currs …” I blast back at the stupid bot. Some of the citizens don’t seem to have enough currs to buy a piece of new clothing attire for the Jubilation Day event, much less for an assortment of expensive food and beverage items inside the food karts which is provided by King Dirk.
I spin back around and sneer at the metal cylinder, “I command you to take and carry each dang food tray to the natives on the floor, Gbot.” I stop and stand in front of the robot as my fluffy plantation skirt wiggles sideways.
“I cannot. Your princess command stands in direct conflict with my guarding programming,” Gbot hums. I sigh with anger.
“Very well stated, Trash can!” I slide sideways and call through the open archway, “Captain!”
The captain and four guards appear and block the archway. The captain enters the room surveying the walls, the ceiling tiles, the open window searching for trouble then halts in front of Starra, “Countess, is there trouble? Are you alright?” A huddle of guards follows behind their captain as ordered by my prince for my protection. I sigh with true love.
I raise both of my palms and stand in front of his tallness shaking my curls, smiling with my princess order, “No! No! I don’t mean to cause ya’ll distress. I was hoping you could take and carry all these delicious food trays to the audience members who sit at the back of the rows.” I point to each table.
The Captain turns and views each side wall seeing the trays of food, scooting around Starra, heading towards the open window while pondering her princessly command. I sigh with puzzlement.
Rann has provided an honor guard unit exhibiting both bulging muscles and bulky brains. I might have to skip the higher IQ levels next time. But their primary paid job isn’t to act as a waiter bot but to watch over Starra. I sigh with safety.
The Captain examines the crowd on the floor then soldierly pivots facing his guard unit, pointing to each side wall. “As you wish, Countess, everyone, come and grab a tray and then follow me down.” He leads to one table picking up a food tray. I sigh with delight.
The guards scatter around and grab a food tray carefully spinning around, slowly leaving the skybox space. I step sideways and block his footpath, wringing my hands with nervousness, “Captain, I do not mean to belittle your honor with menial serving duties. I would do it my…”
“We both know Prince Rann would greatly object. You’re a very generous and kind-hearted noblette, the only one on the planet and in the universe. I’m deeply honored to know and personally serve you sharing your kind gifts with the other citizens.” He deeply bows at his fitted waistline when balancing the heavy food tray in one palm then slowly uprights nodding with a smile to Starra. He scoots around her and leaves the room shouting for at my Gbot and a huddle of more human replacement sentinels guarding the skybox.
Wow! I’m popular in the unknown universe. I sigh with joy.
I waddle ahead and halt in front of the open window eventually seeing my honor guards. They slowly pass out the food items to all the children first while wearing a sweet smile. I sigh with happiness.
I lean down over the ledge and daydream of Rann drowning out Dirk’s words of something. I’m eager to leave my confided space inside a tiny skybox. Rann had utilized some of the Ice skybox floor and wall space for the newly constructed hallway. I don’t mind giving back to the universe. After the activities, Rann and I are flying to Planet Sahara for a fun swimming pool party hosted by our friend Ty and his girlfriend Joy. I love the hot sizzling sunrays there really a deep suntan on my semi-naked body. I sigh with true love.
The time clock seconds silently click closer to the 13th hour of mid-day ending the Jubilation Day activities. You cannot see a visual comlen inside the auditorium space. I am the virtual time clock keeper that clicks down the seconds, when I can hug and kiss on Rann inside his limousine in private again. I sigh with true love.
On top of the stage platform, Dirk finishes the last name and shouts to the audience members. “Are there any prisoners for a speedy law trial?”
When a citizen is caught performing an illegal crime, the citizen is labeled a prisoner without defending their person from the accusation then the legal trial and then the sentencing by the king. But this is Dirk’s universe, not mine. I sigh with injustice.
From the lobby space, two rows of lavender-covered uniforms represent Dirk’s personal honor guard unit marches forward in step without a song escorting a single citizen between their tall, slender bodies slowly moving towards Dirk.
Inside my empty skybox, I lean my upper torso over the wooden edge and study the life form, “What’s that thing?”
A new form of animal moves ahead exhibiting a head of long blonde-tinted hair, four little tiny limbs on a very small body frame. I’m an expert on shortness as I measure five feet and one inch in height. Every person is taller against my body frame, even all my kitchen appliances and bedroom furniture items inside my castle are taller than my petite body frame. The only citizen I can point my chin down to is a small child, not the one who hits puberty either. These days, all the growing teenagers are taller than I am. I sigh with curiosity.
The two rows of guard halt in the middle of the floor. The small animal life form stops then slumps forward wearing a pair of black-tinted, heavy, iron binders on both its wrist and ankle bones.
“What is the crime?” Dirk stares down at the prisoner.
“The crime is thieving, Your Highness,” the lead honor guard nods with a stern face to Dirk.
Animals are wild beasts living within their wilder environment. A wild animal technically doesn’t steal but scrounges for food within their habitants. This is a ridicule idea creating a fantasy crime for a wild animal. I sigh with nonsense.
Just dismiss us now, Dirk! I’m hungry for personal attention from my man Rann. I sigh with true love.
“Detail the crime of the prisoner, please.” Dirk says.
“She stole an apple from one of the food vendor carts at the market,” the guard says.
“She!” I shout out loud and stand upright. The visual line of open noble skyboxes is located on the second floor and several hundred yards from the center of the floor. You cannot see the center of the floor, if you don’t possess a Tele power of enhanced eyesight. Anyways, no noble watches Dirk but plays card or board games with their friends and their honor guards having a good time while the poor citizens endure Dirk’s boring words.
Inside my skybox, I perform a Tele see scanning the animal life form closer. That is not a small animal but a small child standing alone and lonely without her parent or guardian. She is a daughter wearing a pair of heavy, black-tinted wrist and ankle bone iron chains. The child appears six years in age, that’s an Earth measurement. The natives here age in years very rapidly from an earthling. I don’t really know how old the child is or anyone else’s age but Lady Rosa and King Dirk. Now, Rosa is dead and cannot explain the rapid age process. I sigh with puzzlement.
 However, the child appears old enough to know wrong from right as stealing an object without paying the price is a true crime. But the child is a little girl filled with fun and games, maybe she acted on a dare. Or she exhibits mischievous childish behaviors with her friends and family members.
I’m not going to debate that hot topic. I’m the biggest offender of mischievous teen-ass behavior here within the unknown universe. My bad teen habits have gotten my person in plenty of nasty opportunities for numerous severe punishments. An adult should know better and should be punished for an illegal crime against the Crown, the citizens, and the universe. I sigh with immaturity.
However, I repeat my mental argument. This little girl is a child. Children are protected by the kingdom until their 16th birthday party. I read that fact inside the red tinted Book in the first alien timeline. So, a small child should not be standing in front of Dirk wearing a set of painful irons bracelets around her tiny wrist and ankle bones. I sigh with intense rage.
The more I mentally debate this controversial topic inside my sharp neurons, the higher my anger stirs within my kind heart. I sigh with intense fury.
Rann shouts out loud to Dirk, pointing at the child and stands inside his skybox, “Sire, as the owner of Planet Agri, all the food markets on Planet Commerce and throughout the galaxy, and the one voice for the Business Associates, I release the innocent child from all and any criminal charges effective immediately.” The audience cheers and claps for Rann and the child.
“Good job, Rann!” I cheer and clap along with the audience members. Rann has swiftly nipped the immediate royal problem in the budding rose petals. I, personally, am going to inspect the open markets on Jubilation Day from now on. This type of crime will not be occurring any more, especially, if the silly incident involved a young child. I sigh with innocence.
Dirk slowly stands from his chair and stares down at the small child carefully waddling in his long bathroom robe over the polished wood, climbing down each step than halts on top of the dirty floor tiles. He folds his arms and presses the finger tips together in front of his chest nodding with a wicked smirk and shouts out loud to each citizen, “The Crown recognizes the noble prince as the rightful owner of Planet Agri that produces all the food items for all the citizens throughout the galaxy. But this particular crime is not located within your planetary jurisdiction, Rann.” Each audience member bump heads and loudly mumbles.
“What!” I shout out loud as the single word echoes around my empty skybox. I sigh with extremely intense anger.
“Mr. Food Vendor, please, come forth and approacheth the Crown,” he nods with a smile and motions to the person.
My Tele senses ping. Everything ain’t fine, darling!
Rann cannot speak a work or defend the child from Dirk’s wrath. I know that fact and shouldn’t rely on my Tele powers for a logical reaction, since I’m so emotionally charged that I might purposely use them deadly on an arrogant Dirk. Too bad! He would become a big blob of broken white bones and oozing red blood proteins on a dead broken body frame spilling over the dirty auditorium floor. I realize that visual sight will greatly improve his royal appearance. I sigh silliness.
Dirk has arranged this visual display for something; but I’ll search out and find all the inquiring questions: who, what, when, where, and how. I sigh with purpose.
I’m hot on your silky bathroom robe tails, Dirk.
A short, thin, fragile male with a balding head slowly steps from the rear of line of food carts walking beside one of the Commerce honor guards. He twists his cloth hat between ten nervous finger pads.
Now, I completely understand Dirk’s surly comment to Rann. This criminal matter is not held in the Agri air waves or on top of the land jurisdiction environment. The line of food cart vendors resides here inside the auditorium space and manned by Dirk’s staff servant…naw…slaves, if you must know the truth. Rann had instigated this new concept as the tale is told inside the Book that resides on Planet Agri.
Yeah, I do my homework sometimes, when I am bored and Rann is busy with the crops.
All the nobles have and hold a red tinted ancient smelly Book that exhibits some interesting magical spells of love. Just kidding! The Book details tips, tads, and bits of past, present, and future datum.
Back to Rann’s brilliant business arrangement. He wants Dirk to possess tons of currs and fill up Dirk’s personal treasure chest, so Dirk will not act rude and greedy like King Rex. This is a brilliant plan for Rann and a misuse for Dirk. I sigh with disappointment.
I cannot tell as I am too emotional seeing only a Tele void, when I’m out of balance within my Tele metaphysical world.
But I can guess using my common sense and smart brain cells. Dirk is trying to blackmail Rann for more currs in front of the citizens negotiating for the little girl’s freedom. This is the worse nasty evil plan coming from Dirk as he has tried and then failed every criminal act within the universe including a murder attempt, kidnapping, thieving, beating, and stealing. And that short list only applies to my petite alien person. I sigh with past timelines.
I am not the only noble pondering those mental thoughts.
My Tele senses ping. Everything is fine.
Ambassador Ty of Sahara has suddenly appeared inside Rann’s sky box. I execute a Tele probe overhearing their whispered words. They are plotting a gallant rescue attempt of the child and a bloody fist fight on the Commerce honor guards. I sigh with delight.
The Sahara honor guards would pulverize any and all body guards with a tongue spit from Prince Rann. Dirk pays the poorest wages in the universe possessing no currs, so he receives a battalion with the laziest, skinniest, and dumbest rejects from the other noble warrior inventory. The Commerce honor guard duty is to guard Dirk and perform nothing else. I sigh with intrigue.
The Militia pilots and mechanics are smarter and sleeker than these rejects. I find it hard to believe that a Commerce guard found this criminal child using his negative IQ. So, there is a hidden mysterious mastermind behind this sinful social act. Dirk wants something else to occur here inside the auditorium floor during the weekly Jubilation Day activities. I sigh with intrigue.
“Is this the culprit?” Dirk asks the nervous food cart vendor. The audience members sound with a soft groan of worry.
“Yes. This is the child, who steal an apple from my food cart, King Dirk.” He nods with a worried brow. The audience members mutter loudly.
Dirk points at the child and shouts out loud, “I sentence you to two days and nights on the planet of Sahara for stealing an apple.” The audience members sound with a soft moan of defeat.
The tallest Commerce guard reaches out and grabs, jerking with his manly strength on the child’s forearm. The child falls sideways on top of the hard floor still wearing her metal bonds resting on her kneecaps crying in pain. The audience members sound with a softy groan of pain too.
“Stang!” I yell in fury at the unkind injustice on the little child. Dirk accepts someone else’s verbal opinion without any hard evidence or reviewing all the facts and witnesses of the criminal case before a jury of their peers. I think that is Earth justice, not Commerce justice. Dirk is judge, jury, and executor of justice and injustice inside his universe. I respect that yesterday, not today. You can’t convict a little kid for stealing an apple. I sigh with duty.
“Stop!” I yell out loud using a telepathic kick into all the eardrums hearing my princessly command to the guard, executing a Tele leap from the floor, flying through the open window, and then gracefully land on the folds of my puffy, fluffy dress fabric. I had placed a Tele shield, of course, over my body before jumping off the window frame while protecting my kneecaps, legs and two naked feet. I’m dressed in a circular skirt with hundreds of rows of aqua-tinted ruffles and four stiff crinolines underneath a skirt creating a human safety net. I sigh with awesomeness.
Nothing’s going to hurt me today!

Alien Day 156


Prisoner sleeping unit number 78
Temporary home of Starra

7th hour (early morning)
Sizzling heated air currents without clouds at 100°F


I awake seeing the same golden tinted ceiling tiles using my same eyeballs, knowing the same place, jail. At this rate, I’m never going to get married, since I’m never going to get out of here, jail. I replay the terrible events from yesterday within my worried mind. Then, I was only defending my person against a trained assassin, who was attempting to murder my soul. Now, I’m sentenced for one week or five days in a week. There is 50 hours in a day and 50 minutes within an hour, and 50 seconds in a minute. I calculate the math inside my neurons. One week or five days or 100 hours or 5,000 minutes or 250,000 seconds, then I will marry Rann. He always keeps his promise to every citizen. I sigh with promise.
The door swings open and reveals the standard black tinted dangerous robot, saying in a monotone, “Prisoner Starra, your breakfast tray is served.”
I cringe with my same old non-noble title. I sigh with disappointment.

Ty is the noble in charge of his castle, his prison, and his planet, who is both privately and personally watching over Starra. Walls of new comlens have been installed inside the outer room last night for an unwelcomed visitor or rodent. Ty has promised to protect Starra for the extended time one week or five days or 100 hours or 5,000 minutes or 250,000 seconds. I sigh with safety.
No one is going to harm or talk or breath on Starra. Ty and Rann both had a meeting with the rest of the nice and nasty male and female Sahara prison guards and a few of the more influential life-time permanent prisoner inmates here on the Prison Planet. I wasn’t invited, of course, but heard all the flying rumors. Sizzling gossip travels fast than a fire!
Rann has offered tons of his currs for Starra’s protection. In the same sentence, he has offered an instantaneous immediate painful death kill using both of his naked hands with harm to his precious petite princess.
Do you like my ‘P’ sounds?
Last evening, the rumor mill was truthful and true. Some of the nastier prisoner inmates were giving Starra a wide berth as she strolled back to her prisoner sleeping unit for slumber.
Yeah, I’m not popular but protected. I sigh with true love.
